EB4u0XfcaN5od26DkE0J1Q.text: I always get amazing service here. Staff is so nice and accommodating. They make a special order for me every time and it is the best thing ever considering I'm picky. Definitely one of my favorite restaurants!

MNnH9uC8nbnvd9nChLzX-Q.text: We came here for the first time this past Monday, we wanted something simple & not too far from home so based on the reviews we ended up here. As you pull up to park you get the feeling it's a quaint little restaurant, nothing fancy but a nice little neighborhood spot. Well as you walk in it's as if you've just stepped back into time about forty years, mind you the sign says established 1975....... well I think that's the one & only time they've ever decorated this restaurant! We were greeted by I believe the owner who graciously sat us in one of the mini dining rooms, you see there's I believe 5 or 6 mini dining rooms that have about 5 tables in each except for the dining room in back which was larger. There was a bar that had about 15 bar stools & that had actually more customers then the restaurant itself but we got the feeling that most everyone in the restaurant had been regulars for many years therefore we decided we'd give them a try. We decided to start with a glass of Chardonnay for myself & a Stella draft for my hubby, then we were given some complimentary dinner rolls with some prepackaged pats of butter... the rolls were the kind you'd get out of the grocery store.... very basic. We chose to start with the calamari, my hubby chose the top sirloin with shoestring fries & salad bar for his entree, I chose to have the chicken Marsala with a baked potato & homemade chicken corn chowder. The calamari came out which at first glance looked just right & you had two sauces to choose from either cocktail or marinara. The calamari was actually good at first bite & loved that they included the tentacles but the marinara was actually too sweet, also once we got to the end of the calamari we noticed them sitting in a pool of grease because they were not drained long enough..... ended up not taking home the leftover calamari. Then I was served the soup which was actually quite good but very thick & filling, you could definitely tell that it was homemade because the ingredients were nice & fresh. My hubby had the salad bar which was a basic salad bar that has all the typical fixings, one turnoff was the imitation bacon bits...FYI had no idea that they still existed!! Then our entrees came out & my hubby's sirloin that was such a thick cut was a beautiful medium & super moist, he also loved the fries.... it was actually so big that he just couldn't finish his meal. My chicken Marsala was perfectly cooked with the fresh button mushrooms & the sauce was made just right, not too thick & not too runny. The potato was just that a baked potato with some chives but like I said they're definitely stuck in a time warp!! The soup & the entrees were delicious if you want a reasonably priced meal with some good quality meats but SIMPLE, VERY SIMPLE menu that is also kind of stuck in a time warp. It basically brought me back to those childhood memories of where this was the spot your dad would bring the family for a birthday or a special occasion. I'm sure we'll be back when my hubby is in the mood for his carnivore fix but it just won't be our go to spot for a gourmet meal.

ljh9Vdh0zEIulsUl85h-OQ.text: Simply delicious!  Fabulous service!  The Best Food!  It is our family favorite!  We love Feeny's!

PRUYYWdQjohmP0y93Ji8lQ.text: Always on our list of places to visit when in Phoenix.  The owners, staff, and food are fantastic!!

bMag5bQZUunIkPEDvrCXOQ.text: Took the wife out for a birthday dinner. Kudos to the whole staff everything was excellent. Daughter burger came out late and they took it off the bill without being asked. Definitely a place for a special occasion or just a great meal. Will be back again. QCbNBPrZ9GLH5V3qUbtumw.text: Saturday night at Feeney's.  Ordered the Shepard's Pie and Chicken Marsala.  Dinners come with either unlimited salad bar or soup.  We chose the salad.  About 10 items including lettuce ( not the spring mix or anything like it), tomatoes, cukes, onion, cheese, cottage cheese, pepperocini peppers, bacon bits, etc were included.   We chose from 3 salad dressings and I liked the greek dressing.  They offer cold metal plates which keep the salad cold.  The shepard's pie was large and freshly made.  Since shepard's pie is an irish dish I thought I would be made True to Irish form.  Instead,  the meat was cooked Greek style with cinnamon and cloves in it.  It made me like it a lot less than I would without these added items.  Don't like cinnamon in meat.  I then realized (duh) that this is a greek restaurant or at least the cook is.   This is also one of those restaurants who use brown sauce on almost everything.  Even my shepard's pie had brown gravy on.  Ok.  I guess it doesn't hurt.  But when hubby's chicken marsala came with the same brown gravy, he didn't like it much.  What he disliked was that it was just an un-breaded, under-seasoned chicken cutlet, plated, and then topped with brown gravy with marsala wine in it.  This is not the way to make chicken marsala.  The chicken cutlet has to be partially sauteed in light olive oil and then transferred to a pan of marsala wine sauce and allowed to finish cooking there. He said that while the cutlet was not overcooked, once you cut into it, it had no taste.  So if given the opportunity, he would not order that dish again.  The service is very good and attentive at Feeney's.  So if you like a decent salad bar and not overly expensive dishes,  Feeney's will make you happy.

QEuOm-3O3CyJE5sFX82xfQ.text: Huge disappointment.  Was visiting from out of town when a local friend recommended Feeney's.  Went there for dinner.  Prime Rib was cold and nothing special.  My girlfriend and I both had a baked potato and they were cold and seemed like they had been sitting out all day.  Girlfriend ordered the Pan seared Walleye which had skin on one side and many bones in it.  She had 2 bites and that was it.  Really disappointing when you drop $100+ for dinner for 3 (our friend joined us) and sent most of it back to be thrown out.  Was told my the server that we would get bread with our salads....it eventually showed up, half way through dinner.

D-dgHFick8NbORJ-F6sFHw.text: Nice non- commercialized dinner restaurant for good steaks and a variety of good food.  Best part is the family atmosphere with the nice waiters/waitresses.  That and of course the salad bar is amazing.  Great place for a date or to hang out in the small bar for a drink.  There is also a patio area which seems to be run by the locals/regulars that are always very friendly.  Food is reasonable priced with nothing crazy or out of the ordinary.  I plan to keep on coming back and exploring all the unique menu items

T0ZGqS7bJLB6X-iS9HxSnQ.text: Had dinner last night it was fabulous. The service here is just phenomenal. They came to fill my drink before it was empty SEVERAL times. From the moment we walked in the door it felt like they wanted us to be there. We will be back for sure.   The prime rib was perfect!

DyffUIVi-eY7jSYd0A_3cw.text: Old school vibe. Had a pretty good rib eye here.  The salad bar was legit.  I went thru the line twice.  Nice neighborhood feel to it. The bar by the front was dimly lit and a place I wouldn't mind hiding out and drinking in one afternoon.  Prices were reasonable.

B_ZVeGT1SC2eu3pvqsciOA.text: This place was so sweet and welcoming. the food was delicious too. it made me feel like i was at my grandmothers or something. we walked in and a gentleman asked where we wanted to sit, instead of telling us. then there was about 2-4 ppl checking on us. they joked with us, were sweet with my kids and talked to them instead of me, which i love because they are ppl that can speak for themselves. ugh i just can't say enough about this place. definitely will visit again next time i'm in phoenix.

jbQavdmWo8y72_F3Bcsrzw.text: Best burgers in town.  Went with a co worker during lunch, food was great and service was wonderful.  A must vist again.

5nAQjGfT7clKmwdIv8BoJw.text: I bought a few restaurant.com gc's & Feeney's was one of them. I have never been here, let alone heard of this place, but I checked it out on Yelp & the reviews were positive so I thought why not?! We arrived at about 8pm this past Saturday. It wasn't busy but it wasn't dead either, I would say there were about 10 other parties there maybe more. From the looks of the building & decor it seemed that Feeney's had been around for quite some time, definitely had character. For starters we ordered the crab stuffed mushrooms & I ordered a couple cocktails (strawberry vodka w/cranberry juice-yum!). The app was pretty good but it lacked flavor. I have to say Red Lobster's version is better. For our entrees, my hubby ordered the king crab legs & I ordered the filet medalions. You can't really go wrong w/crab legs, hubby loved them! I had a bite & the meat was sweet & very fresh. I am never one to clean my plate, but I finished my entire entree! The meat was cooked perfectly (medium-rare) & the mashed potatoes/asparagus were delicious as well. I wish I had received more asparagus though, only 2 pieces were given. Oh & I almost forgot, our meals came with their famous salad bar. Our salads were pretty good but kinda boring. I thought there would be more of a wow factor there but it wasn't a disappointment or anything since I am not really a "salad person". After devouring our meals we were stuffed but I wanted dessert for later so I ordered their mud pie to go. It was pretty standard but damn it was good. Chocolate cookie crust, mocha ice cream & chocolate ganache-freakin delish! With the $25 gc our total came to about $70 (including tip). Not cheap, especially for the area, but I have to say it was pretty good! We would definitely come back, I am curious to try their $4 burger special on Mondays.

txc2r9g6KCnBTG3Nu-OCJQ.text: Great almond trout!  Get family run business feel and vibe.  Awesome place for a group dinner or place to grab a drink.

Ck9oEjCiBuHFnFKjO1UyyQ.text: Had a fun time here at Dottsy's UYE here.  Good cheap beer and burgers, on a Monday, and friendly service.

Us2DnHBpL_u2VtawOM9-9w.text: Mmm i love feeneys and it also helps that its a redskins bar considering my boyfriend is a skins fan. We are there every Sunday morning

H2UFbWQd4LZxnur2ELfUgg.text: This was the first place my uncle brought me to when I moved to Phoenix. I just retired from the military, from the moment I walked into feenies I felt at home, Maria and Judy have a way of making you feel at home.  I ordered the club sandwich with French fries and a salad bar. The best steak fries and freshly ground pepper with the salad bar I was hooked. As I continued to visit feenies and have become a regular, everyone that works and visits feenies has become my second family. I've explored the menu and it just keeps getting better and better, I've also made some odd requests (gravy and rolls), and George is always there to accommodate my every request.  Amanda  the bartenders joyful spirt is always appriciated. I bring all my friends and family to feenies, and the whole crew always makes everyone feel at home. The new brunch menu is amazing, George is the master mind behind it and he continues to make great progress.

ugv9nS0jrLkg6zB0vSTzeQ.text: Great service, great ambiance.  LOVED the low arches and brick walls inside.  BUT Prime rib was barely warm, and broccoli was even cooler.  The bernaise sauce they brought was a bit curdled.  They were busy, but not swamped.  Maybe it was an off night.

2JRbKEBYWgy4-q2vogccTA.text: i'm feelin' a feeney. ya know what i mean? prolly not. but thats ok.  Feeney's is just a cool spot on the travels of my life. one of my favorites bartenders from Hanratty's works here now, Whats up Chrystal..we gotta do brunch soon. :)  Feeney's has a bomb patty melt. i love patty melts. greasy, cheesy, burgery and oniony. yep check all four things on the list. definetly something to check out if your in the area. awesomeness lives here. it's pure WIN...trust me.

tBA-fBREjWUY5j54a0N5KA.text: We had dinner last Friday night, party of about 20 of us... This was my first time to Feeneys, but have friends who have been going there for many, many years... I've heard so many different opinions from, Fantastic to old dirty dive! My first impressions were good, nice old school feel, very old building, but I like nostalgia. I think we are to quick to knock down an older building to rebuild, and I wish we would keep some of the older establishments around.. Anyway.... Feeneys has a good and fresh salad bar with the BEST homemade blue cheese dressing I've ever had, I can't rave enough about the blue cheese, I think they should bottle & sell it! I had the "Feeneys cut" of Prime rib (rare) with there delicious au ju & horseradish sauce (ask for the plain horseradish to add to there standard sauce, it makes ALL the difference) Gotta say Best Prime Rib I've had in years! The service was very good as well, the owner actually waited on us & my party didnt make it easy on her, they asked for separate checks, and she did a phenomenal job.. Everyone enjoyed what they ordered & heard the lamb chops were awesome...Two thumbs up! The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5, is because there was some sticky stuff on table where I was sitting when I arrived, but they quickly cleaned it up for me! I'll be taking my Momma to Feeneys for Prime rib & of course salad with blue cheese dressing very soon!

Mn2NNg_42bu7wEqHxAc5Kg.text: I've been going to this restaurant at least once a month for the past 6 years. The fish, steak and prime rib dinners at Feeney's are excellent  and include one of the best salad bars I've seen anywhere. A basket of fresh rye and pumpernickle bread and butter is included as well.  The prices are very reasonable and the service is above excellent.. They really want to make sure you're enjoying your meal and have everything you want. The Mudd Pie is incredible and gets 5 starts all by itself.

S1M7GnOGjyT6Y8jcjNCiRg.text: Great neighborhood joint! It's a place to go when you're craving good steak but don't want to pay steakhouse prices. The service is always excellent, and I don't think I've ever had a bad item on the menu.

CyF8uXYxQGUyHosAGaEYDQ.text: Chances are you haven't heard of Feeney's.   It used to be the Cork 'n Cleaver twenty or thirty years ago, but it has since split off and now is its own steakhouse and bar.   I can't speak thoroughly as to the food, since it has changed substantially since my last visit to eat, but I understand that the menu has expanded and has a Greek flair to it now.  The bar, however, I can speak to. It is probably the darkest bar I have ever spent much time in and I love that about it. Their motto should be "Redefining Shady."   It is a dive in many respects, but the regulars may not agree with that. Drinks are cheap and easy to come by in the very small bar area, and everyone seems to know the bartenders by name. If they know you and like you, you can even request music or bring in a CD and they may play it for you while you sip a smokey gin and tonic. But play your cards right, because they absolutely play favorites.   The patio is comfortable for one group only but, it's all yours if you get it first.

Kmd_bXkWID1HKvOWo314UA.text: Great place! Excellent prime rib. The staff and owners are very friendly and service is great. I love this place and go there frequently. It's a little neighborhood gem.

38Ck71dFKfrlziFrvizXoA.text: The burgers are great. The decor is definitely old school, but the waitstaff are friendly.

kt48kKUNIgDqYVqRUAatAg.text: This place is very outdated on the decore, and the customers are kinda older too, but they are on to something! they have a great salad bar and a great menu! everyone who was working there seemed happy and helpful.  The drinks are GREAT as well! Everyone I know loves the Monday night burger special........ $4 burgers with fries so they say! I stick with the fish and chips! they are amazing!

QjTjlZ-5M6R1anqgU9W3IA.text: I've driven by this place many times and never noticed it!! But per YELP...I found it. Went there a month ago.  Its not what you'd expect. A little dated inside, but the staff is very friendly. (Although, our waiter didn't stop by that much and it took a while to get our order in). Anyway,  I went there for dinner (party of 8) and we got our own little room practically. So it was nice to be able to not shout at anyone (like you do in most crowded restaurants). I ordered fish and it was really good (can't recall which one, sorry--white fish of some sort) And it came with their little salad bar option. (which was nice to be able to go up and get as much as you want). Overall I enjoyed this restaurant and would go back.

xGrXU9EQrk2gcnabkBwXyg.text: I've been here a couple times now and like it more, and more each time. First off they have the best Saganaki I've had in a restaurant, the cheese is very sharp and salty like it should be, and the portion size is very generous compared to most other places. I love the old school salad bar- ice cold metal plates, bacon bits, beets, macaroni and potato salads, jello, etc, reminds me of restaurants I went to as a kid. The dressings are really good and homemade, I heard one of the employee's dictating the recipes to another last time we were there. I've had the pork chops, a couple pasta dishes and the fish and chips, all were very, very good. The tartar sauce w/ the fish and chips was so good, it was surprising. That had to be homemade as well. Last time we were there we had the Mud Pie for dessert, another old school item, and it was huge and delicious. The staff is always super friendly and on top of everything. Great, great place and I'm looking forward to more great dinners here.

C_4BGdd6_qSSxN2tJkDGHg.text: Excellent  Amsphere, great staff, and good food! Love this place!

jJp5A_-bIgt8nNPQB5OepA.text: this is a great place to go if you're looking for quality food at AFFORDABLE prices and a nice cozy atmosphere! they specialize in steaks and seafood but have other choices on the menu. i think this is a romantic place. it's small,  the lighting is low, candles on the table, and just all around intimate. this is not a large chain type of restaurant where you will be lost in the crowd and ignored.  the steaks & primerib are great. the prices are very affordable, much cheaper then anything like outback steakhouse or black angus. i get a large steak for about $15.00 and the primerib is priced under $24.  there are numerous daily fish specials to choose from which range anywhere from $9-$13. there are all sorts of fish dinners. you get an all you can eat salad bar with all meals. the appetizers are good and all appetizers are priced under $8. we always get the calamari. they do have a small bar area in the front. THE SERVICE IS ALWAYS BEYOND GOOD. THE WAIT STAFF IS VERY FRIENDLY AND THE OWNER OF THE RESTAURANT WILL ALWAYS COME BY AND GREET YOU AND MAKE SURE YOU ARE HAPPY WITH YOUR EXPERIENCE. they treat you very well and appreciate their guests. i go to this restaurant for all special occasions.  as an added benefit, THIS RESTAURANT IS ON  RESTAURANT.COM    IF YOU GO TO THIS WEBSITE, YOU WILL GET $25 OFF YOUR BILL OF $50 OR MORE. feeney's is on 12st, just south of glendale.

aO9bdDDkFJjy5JylMpT3Yw.text: I'm not impressed in the slightest. We sat down fast and had our orders taken. Started with potatoes skins which were beyond cold in the middle and SO greasy. I ordered a burger and my boyfriend ordered the steak and lobster tail. My burger was okay but my boyfriends food... ordered medium rare steak and ended up with a very bloody rare steak which is disgusting. His lobster tail was burnt on the shell and trying to cut through it was like cutting through a thick piece of rubber. Our waitress dropped our food off and is never to be seen again. We waited 20 minutes until we could find a worker to help. We spoke to a gentleman and he said he would get the waitress but it took 10 minutes before we realized we'd be here waiting another 20 minutes for someone to come around so we just left. Poor service and poor quality. Not a place I will recommend

5lLVcZqvNg2el7rpHrXZsw.text: My husband and I visited Feeney's for our anniversary dinner and we were not disappointed.   The food: Overall, I think it was great. I ordered the top sirloin and my husband ordered the medallions. He loved his dish! He didn't leave one piece of food behind on his plate. Mine was good except the steak didn't have very much flavor. I'll be honest, it tasted as though they forgot the seasoning altogether. It definitely was a quality piece of meat but lacked the flavor. The mashed potatoes were heaven though. Once I added A-1 sauce to my steak, the dish was fantastic. On top of that you get warm rolls to accompany your food. The salad bar was amazing! I typically don't like eating from salad bars because some people aren't as sanitary as they could be but this one was good. The salad was crisp and cold. The toppings were fresh and it was very clean.  Experience: The owners made us feel like family. They were so pleased to have us there on our special day. They even brought us a slice of the Mud pie with a candle and it was to die for! The owner hugged us and said "We'll see you soon". It was almost like they could read our minds. We will definitely be back again soon.

Tst80l9kft9f9fwil30UqQ.text: Amazing amazing amazing. I have told every person that will listen how amazing my prime rib was on Saturday night. Loved the atmosphere as well. As soon as I saw cottage cheese, potato salad, and macaroni salad at the salad bar I knew we picked the right place. Reminded me of a bunch of steak places I would go to in the Midwest. Kudos to the owners you have a gem. I will definitely be back and the prices are affordable. Better than going to a Maestros or a Morton's and paying a la carte and feeling stuffy. I loved everything about it.

hniUqa2LLmK6R_8Cb-e1MA.text: The best way to describe this place is a dive bar. Incense, burning in the bathrooms, wafts throughout the place.   Shrimp cocktail with nary a hint of horseradish (seemed almost like a tomato sauce), cold baked potato and creme brulee that, well tasted like the burnt parts of a roasted marshmallow.   The prime ribs was good and the wait staff was awesome though.   All and all I can't see how this place gets 4 stars.

LXaua4bV6J9cI22k_xa5tQ.text: I absolutely love this place! I come here every few months to treat myself to their amazing prime rib! The atmosphere and the staff is so wonderful. Brought my friends here for their first time and they loved it as well. Keep up the amazing job!

b6ZnHPiAd61_jiDoxbdCoQ.text: Delicious!! Everything! Great place to take out of town guests or a date . Good for families too! burgers are delicious... wiping my chin...ooh and they have a great salad bar. Try the Beef Wellington and Calamari for sure.

lHWYrW3ZPdqQ1OAkzSg-5A.text: Welcome to 1971. This place has been stuck in a time warp for the last 45 years. That being said, they know how to cook proteins. I had the Osso Buco and it was done perfectly...hot all the way through and tender as can be smothered in brown mushroom gravy. Do not go here if you are looking for trendy gastropub fare with new fangled dishes and culinary creativity. Go here if you want and old style quiet meal with friendly service. There are lots of upscale menu items like beef wellington and lobster. The salad bar is weak at best. The imitation bacon bits are a real downer. It would be easy not to like this place, but they can cook good old style food. I am conflicted and don't really know how to rate a place that doesn't really fit into any recognizable category of restaurant. This place is just different. Try it and see if it works for you. Maybe, maybe not.....

5iM1vo5qR8aL5mdgQtpj7w.text: Great staff,  food could use a bit of help.  Prime rib was traditional,  but I'm a prime rib snob.  Potatoes tasted like over boiled.  Salad bar needs some help.

k-St1oH113-1gnS949Rr5w.text: My husband and I were in town for a conference. It was his birthday and he wanted to have a good steak. We had looked on yelp for various restaurants and Feeney's received good reviews. My husband had the ribeye steak and I had the salmon. Both of them were amazing. The service was wonderful. We received our food quickly and it was prepared well. We enjoyed the atmosphere. It had a small town feel. We will recommend this restaurant

Hhkgb4ZQhFiqhi0nfw_eFQ.text: I live within walking distance of Feeney's but I've only been there about a half-dozen times because there always seemed to be somewhere else to go for a bite or a brew. But I was in the mood for a good old-fashioned steak dinner and made a point of heading there tonight. I won't be back.  There's charm inside this building, if a little stuffy and warm on a summer evening, and there's no denying the friendliness of the staff. But friendliness and charm aren't substitutes for quality and service. On past visits, I've eaten in the little sitting area off the bar, which is more casual and under the eye of the bartender. Previous meals have been fish and chips, burgers, and appetizers, and they've been mostly suitable. I guess I don't have high expectations for potato skins and calamari, snacks that could've come from a bag in the freezer, but I was disappointed by fish and chips, an entree that looks like it fell from a TV dinner carton. That experience kept me from returning to the dinner menu for a couple of years. No matter. I was in the mood for red meat and that is supposed to be their specialty.  I ordered the top sirloin steak medium-rare and French fries. I got a thick steak on the wrong side of medium-well and pedestrian shoestring potatoes that were cold to the touch and basically inedible. The steak tasted fine but with almost no pink inside, it was some tough chewing. Maybe the cook made the fries too soon and overcooked the steak by accident or maybe the server forgot to pick up my order and it sat on a counter, the steak continuing to cook from carryover heat while the fries cooled down. Considering how seldom I saw my server and how long it took to get my order, either explanation is plausible.  Local restaurants are fun to patronize but it's not worth it if the product is overpriced and the service is lacking. My money will go where it spends the best. It won't be spent at Feeney's any longer.

WbYsFpFurwlWmkga_i3M-Q.text: I love a local place where the regulars are smoking outside and taking their spots at the bar which is where I ate. Started off by the nicest lady greeting me and making me feel like a regular even though this is my first visit. I ordered the fried zucchini as I love that appetizer. This one had actual flavor in the breading and you could taste the zucchini and was delicious. The chicken vegetable soup tasted homemade. I don't know if it was but it tasted it. So good. The trout almandine was the perfect portion size and do I really need to say why the baked potato was so good? Why can't everyone make a perfect baked potato? The flavors on my meal were outstanding.  NOW.... most won't agree with my review. Most people like that trendy... mediocre... Luke warm greeting by hired kids as hostesses (I don't go to Hillstone any longer after years of patronage because I just got tired of the pretentiousness of the staff.... you work there... stop acting like that makes you better than me) and food that is good but not outstanding and the prices about 7-9 dollars more than the food is worth.... I mean.... 5-9$ for a bake potato other places? Please. This is a place where you have to choose from many popular items on the menu and you can come back 2-3 times a month or more.... because it's like eating at home but in a restaurant. I was happy to eat here. I will definitely be back. If you need to see and be seen go to the new places. If you just want to eat a good decent meal.... Feeney's is it. Old school. I feel like everyone from the cooks to the very nice bartender.... George was invested in my dinner.... oh the lady who nicely greeted me and talked to me on the way out?..... THE OWNER. good luck with that at any trendy Phoenix restaurant. Mealand appetizer with a good glass of Merlot.... $35. I feel as though I got my money's worth. I mean jeez I just spent $348 with tip for dinner for two at Steak 44. I don't think it was $300 better than my meal here.... even though Steak 44 is still my favorite restaurant. Please try this place the next time you get tired of being disappointed at other places. I'm thinking your review would be 3-4 stars. Not me. I like and miss this type of restaurant.

cqMnt09GwJZLSVlI8cOFXQ.text: Went here for lunch with family for my birthday and it was awful. Took 10 minutes for someone to come over to get a drink order from us. We were informed she was the bartender and the only one working the whole restaurant, so felt kind of bad. BUT, 30 minutes later we were still waiting for our hummus to come out. Our lunch came out much after that and it was just so so. I had a pasta dish with chicken that was kind of bland, mom had fish and chips which she said were just ok. Burgers looked good. It was just Meh. They would've been better suited having one bartender and one server cuz that wasn't fair for her. Dont even know her name as she never told us, but she was nice.

yhLjDM7dWOsNSsKn2ViN8g.text: We've been dying to have dinner here (happy hours have been top notch.)   The old school ambiance, complete with the classic salad bar is worth the trip alone.  The Manhattan Chowder was maybe the best I've had.  The Prime Rib and Beef Wellington were solid choices, particularly with the yummy twice baked potatoes.  The lamb chops were flavorful but could have been a little more tender.  Probably the only thing that we wouldn't try again is the Shepherds Pie.  However, the highlight of the meal was the impressive Baked Alaska for dessert.  We'll be back!

JQjSCceya1ryoJAgjcSGQg.text: I have been here many times as Mama Maria and her staff always treat us like family! We went for my husbands 50th bday and as always everything was amazing! Thank you Maria and Judy!

diYE78EbS34xzP9J8geCRg.text: To say that this was disappointing is an understatement. My husband and I wanted to give this place a whirl to celebrate our 5 year anniversary. We set up a reservation through Open Table and were excited to have a lovely steak & lobster/crab dinner...until...  Not sure if they lost 1/2 their staff that night (no one was paying attention to the door), but we walked in, looked around for a host/ess or a sign that said "Seat Yourself". Not seeing either option, we kinda lurked around the bar area and stood watching a basketball game. About 5-10 minutes in, a woman said she would be right with us. Once we were seated, we were asked immediately what we would like to drink (yes, before we had any menus). Hubby ordered a beer and asked for a wine list. Then no contact for another 10-15 minutes. The table on the side of ours was muttering something about not seeing their waiter for awhile.   Prior to arriving, I researched their menu and was really looking forward to trying their Oscar Tournedos dish (filet topped with crab meat and a bernaise sauce over mashed potatoes). The waiter, initially unsure as to whether they still had that dish, informed me that it is no longer on the menu. He said that the filet medallions would be somewhat comparable as long as I like gorgonzola cheese. I went with it. Hubby had the ribeye medium rare, and we ordered the potato skins appetizer (ONLY because of the Yelp deal when we checked-in, otherwise I don't order potato skins) and the salad bar. I ordered a glass of Malbec.   The wine was delicious. the potato skins were tasty, if a bit overdone. The salad bar was really good. My steak was a little underdone (I ordered medium (as I was informed that if I usually order medium well, then medium is the way to go), it came back as medium rare. Not necessarily a deal-breaker for me (since it was a quality piece of meat), but I am unsure as to where the gorgonzola was underneath all of that thick brown gravy. *sigh*   Once the plates were on the table, we never saw our waiter again. We never got any water refills. We were never asked if we would like another beverage even though our glasses were empty. After asking for our bill 4 times, the lady from the beginning of our journey meandered her way to our table, mentioned something about it being a tough night (I think the cook walked out?), and asked if we needed anything. I mentioned that we were disappointed with the service, that it was our anniversary, that we were really looking forward to the experience but were disappointed in how the evening went, and, to add insult to injury, not only did she disregard all of that, she also charged us for the potato skins.   The table that was looking for their waiter in paragraph 2 was still waiting for something when we left. If I were a betting woman, I would say they were just waiting for the opportunity to slink out of there since it seemed as though no one really cared one way or the other.

fiKeWGXwXI4xu3-RVbfizw.text: A hidden gem situated in Uptown Phoenix, the owners couldn't be any nicer. Great steak house cooking up all your favorites like ribeye, prime rib and fish dishes. When we stop in we're greated by the owner who gives us a big hug, it's like going to Mom's steak house. I've been eating here for years, so it was about time I posted a review. Hope to see you here!!!

97Vm_LfEmMgtSNCCaNfRmw.text: So glade I found this restaurant. The owner is such a lovely lady and starts your most perfect evening. We ate there 2 times last week and looking forward to many more times. Order the pork chops, I can find words to describe how wonderful they are.

sZKpP4eI-NDUH5e-Fo2mxw.text: Yelp said it's a good place, hubby wanted to try it. Won't be going back.  Took close to an hour to get food, ordered the shepards pie.  Wasn't very good and the gravy tasted like outta a jar.  The place is old, dark and gloomy.

onC_OTA90YzhTWW4utGvsg.text: Visited Feeney's for the first time last night. My first thought was that the inside is much more interesting than the outside. The outside in a fairly nondescript building on 12th St. The inside is more of a retro-throwback to an old school steak house.   We started with escargot and potato skins (the skins were a freebie via Yelp check-in). Both were good, but neither was great. For dinner, my wife had Pork Osso Bucco and I had the Beef Wellington with a Twice Baked Potato. The Osso Bucco was very big portion of shank served on top of mashed potatoes. It was well prepared and tasty. The Beef Wellington was very good as well. A petite filet wrapped in pastry dough and covered with mushroom sauce. Twice baked potato was good as well (quite large actually..)  Overall, our experience was good. The one negative, perhaps a pet peeve of mine, was walking by the outdoor patio to enter and patio is full up with people smoking. I would prefer not to walk through a wall of smoke to enter.   N*joy...

Fmf_g5GWObA0mwEdllpevA.text: I found this place because my mom was craving liver and onions. Upon arrival, it didn't look like much from outside, but once you go in, you encounter old world charm. My mom who's originally from Germany fell in love with the style of this restaurant/bar. We were greeted as soon as we walked in the door and were seated. Thereafter the owner followed up and recommended the special of the day- 3 tacos made with prime rib. I ordered the special and my mom ordered the liver and onions. The food was delicious- my mom is picky and she loved her food. My tacos were outstanding- the meat perfectly cooked and so tender- they came with an avocado-garlic mayo which was to die for- and also rice pilaf which I did not like- it was a bit salty.   The owner offered drinks from the bar- however we had coffee and water.  They have daily specials at great prices.   Pros & cons Pros- the owner is very attentive and he genuinely cares about his customers. I noticed all of the staff working together to get their jobs done and they all smiled. The restaurant was clean, and tables bussed immediately. The food is superb, the meat is fresh and tender. The bar appears to offer many different beers and drinks. Great vibe throughout and they have an outdoor seating area right at the front entrance.  There is also a larger dining area towards the back which was well lit.   Cons- it was a little dark when you first walk in-front dining room- low ceilings contribute to this, the bathroom is a bit small and not handicap friendly ( my mom uses a walker and it was very hard to get into the larger stall) and there was a sewer odor in the restroom. No lemon offered for my water. We will definitely be returning when we are in the area; we found a new favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Liver and onions cooked perfectly
Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tuesday special- prime rib tacos $6.95

sjngsrx9XBrl1e-mu6hFTw.text: A group of three of us went on a Wednesday night for the first time.  I ordered the salisbury steak (one of the Wednesday $10 specials) and it was fantastic.  It was thick and juicy and topped with a wonderful mushroom gravy.  The mashed potatoes were homemade and very, very good.  The meal came with the salad bar which was nicely stocked with fresh items.  It wasn't a large salad bar, but it was perfect for a pre-meal salad.  Our waitress was friendly and attentive.  She had a lovely accent (Russian maybe?) and made sure we never ran out of beer.  Overall, it was a fun experience and we'll definitely be going back.

aEx5TiqxWpL2e640pCiTUg.text: We just found this place and WOW!! The food was perfect, the staff was ever so helpful and we met some of the regulars who made us feel like we belonged.  I will be back again,

9IOdW0cbjpxTDzJ50JRjgw.text: Had the Envious Passion, and was duly impressed.  The salad bar was nice and fresh, and well stocked.  The London Broiled was tender and delicious, the au jus was very savory.  I had a wonderful time, and would love to return.

NQmAsLAzTC7_gFzc98J1cQ.text: Bees knees Beef Wellington! My husband and I came here not knowing what to expect and we were blown away! Not only was the beef Wellington the most amazing dish ever, the staff was also wonderful! They treated us with such gratitude and we were just as grateful for their service! We came specifically for the beef Wellington on the menu, but the rest of the menu sounded amazing as well. We will definitely be here for dinner again!

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Fu8ufjpQBnGw_Bnkg04ixg.text: This was a little gem of a place we happened to find, good food, good service, funky older location, try it!

aFU87QodWi5o0PAIhOjcxQ.text: I used to come for the booze (I actually still do!) but I wound up bringing my family in for dinner while they were visiting from out of town. Being the zealous consumer of lamb that he is, my father ordered the Greek-style lamb chops. Needless to say that every time he's in town, he HAS to go to Feeney's and have the lamb. He has since tried the pork chops (also Greek-style) and is just as much of a fan of those. I've brought in other family since who are also nuts about the lamb. So bottom line, if you're into lamb, come here and take it Greek-style! Not a lamb eater myself, I usually get the filet mignon. There is just something about the way the filet is prepared, old-school style and not a lot of bells and whistles. Bells and whistles are not needed because it's just so damned good: tender and flavorful. What else is delicious? The calamari is AWESOME-probably one of my favorite in any restaurant anywhere. The service here is above and beyond. Maria and George and the rest of the servers treat all of their customers like family which is why they have so much repeat business. In addition, you will never have an empty glass in front of you, whether is beer, wine cocktails, soda, coffee, even your glass of water is always refilled. Sure there are other places in The Valley that are fancier where the food comes to your table almost too pretty to eat, but that comes with a price tag and often a nice appearance is used to mask inferior quality. Not the case here, you always enjoy a good, down-home, no-nonsense meal with great service and all at a VERY reasonable cost.

hHAFMyz3ZCaWyJzNgrq76Q.text: I'm updating my review of Feeney's, as when I read the review of my initial visit, I was sort of shocked. It is now one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix.  First, make sure you check out their website for the nightly specials. Wednesday night is particularly great, with your choice of 5 freshly prepared entrees, including potato or vegetable, AND soup or salad for $10. Nice.  Second, when you check in on yelp, look for the instant 10% off coupon. Immediately. For that use. Not a "10% off after 4 visits" or a one time use. Every time. Nice.  Third, I am always a bit taken aback by the sincere friendliness of the staff, especially the owner. She always remembers us, even when we haven't been for a few months and we are always greeted with a big hug and a hearty "Hello! Welcome back!". Nice.  Fourth, the salad bar that I was unimpressed with in my first review impresses me now not for its variety, but for its consistently fresh and always well stocked bounty. Not only leafy salads on the salad bar, but some slaws, a few pasta salad choices, and lots of very fresh veggies. And I'm a sucker for the carrots that have been shaved into curls and the cool fresh ground pepper mill. While you are getting your salad, the chef(s) will routinely visit with you, as the kitchen is right behind the salad bar. Nice.  On my visit last night, I started with the onion rings as an appetizer. They were good. No flavorgasm like the ones at Durant's, but then how could they compete with those? I had the $10 special Salisbury steak with mashed potatoes and salad. Salisbury steak has been much maligned by the Swanson TV Dinners of old. When done right, and Feeney's does it right, it is a flavorful piece of ground prime steak. Here's a hint, if they ask you how you want your Salisbury steak cooked, you pretty much know it is going to be better than the chopped steak meal you are going to get at other restaurants. The mushroom gravy is an added treat for both the steak and the mashed potatoes. Another at the table subbed the fresh veggies for the potato, and they were a nice assortment of zucchini, squash, and broccoli. Not a limp, greasy garnish like you get some places if you opt out of the potato portion. Nice.  Another hug upon our leaving. Goodbyes from the waiter and the bar staff. You can easily see why most of people you see in Feeney's are regulars. Count me as one now.

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Feeney&#39;s salad bar.

fuht46oySue95XMUvzGTVA.text: Monday nights you get a sirloin burger and fries for $4 -- awesome deal. Good burger. Add cheese, avocado, bacon, mushrooms, etc. for a small up charge. Get all you can eat (simple) salad bar for an additional $2.75. TVs with Monday night football in the bar and on the patio -- great, chill Monday night option.

L_CVDrTZw9daQqXkkeR0ig.text: I have been here on several occassions.  Most for the Monday night special $4 hamburger which is one of the best I have tasted.  Quality meat. They have specials every night and mostly the same things.  I had the prime rib special one night but nothing to write home about., Salad bar is good but not great.  Not, a lot of choices, just average items. Small semi private dining areas with about 6 to 8 tables in each. Bar area which also has an area of dining tables.  Be sure if you sit at the bar to ask if the seat is reserved as there are locals who come in and if  you are sitting in their seat will let  you know.

7mgEb_Yya9hd6IttD9VoWw.text: First some of my background....20+ years as a waitress, hostess, catering captain, catering business owner.    We arrived at 5 pm on 12/31.  The first words out of the hostess/owner's mouth were "do you have a reservation?"  Not a good sign.  I snuck a peek at the reservation book, and there were a handful before 6 pm but no more.  I said that no, we thought we were safe coming in at 5.  She gave us the stink-eye and  proceeded to make a big deal about "finding" a table.  This while there were maybe 2 tables occupied in the whole place.  We should have taken the opportunity to say "thank you very much" and turned around and walked away, but we did not...having been wanting to try this place for a long time.  We sat and were waited on by the hostess herself.  Cordial enough, but no offering of a wine list or anything.  Clearly getting the bum's rush from the beginning.  We opted for a glass each of the house wine since no other options were given (generally we would order a bottle).  The wine was horrible, watered down and flavorless.  We ordered prime rib (Traditional cut) for $22 each.  Salad bar was small but good and fresh.  Meals were timed quickly after the salad was cleared.  Prime rib was decent, mine was not medium rare but more medium, barely room temp.  I had the steamed veggies which were done fine...husband had baked potato.  We were quickly offered coffee which we refused...at this point we couldn't get out of there quickly enough.    While the food was decent and the prices were reasonable, it was the initial treatment and the feeling of needing to free up the table that will keep us from ever returning.  Next time we will stay and have dinner at Dick's Hideaway where we had cocktails before venturing into Feeney's.

z3fE5NoTxcljMhgqRgimHA.text: This is place is solid.  It's not fancy; it's in an old building with a low ceiling, but it's family run and very welcoming.  I like to support places like this.  Much better than a chain restaurant.  The chicken piccata was delicious.  All meals come with your choice of soup or a trip to the salad bar, plus your choice of sides.  Portions were solid.  You won't leave hungry.

paGv0IlKRqZ5KdiPFL5j6g.text: I had a philly cheese steak and my fiance had the beef Wellington ..Both were great. This place is also accommodating to the little ones. They got chicken nuggets.

Y0yGYULr1OKz-rg_D5I6FA.text: Nice quaint little restaurant. Nothing major negative to say but overall it was not what I was hoping for in a quality restaurant. If you are going to price like an upscale steakhouse then you should deliver like an upscale steakhouse. This was really nothing more than a nice neighborhood restaurant. Would not return.

BYzthnitRYLEu-WG7UeqtQ.text: Loved my NY steak but you won't if you don't like garlic. Heavily seasoned.  My friends prime rib was so fatty he only ate about a third of it.  Service was very friendly but our table was  so near the bar it ruined our experience.  Paid way too much for dinner to have to listen to a bar full of local dudes watching football.  Finally, I was actually excited for the salad bar. It has been a long time since I've been to a restaurant that actually still has a salad bar. It was unimpressive.

c8jCTQQDfSFHUVas7gGvww.text: I went here last weekend with the BF's parents to see if we would like to have our rehearsal dinner here. When we first walked in, I wasn't 100% convinced because this place is old school....like what I remember a sizzler or something looking like in the 90's. The place is dark and it has an old school salad bar.... need I say more? But this place really surprised me with their excellent service and food. We started with apps (which is totally unnecessary because the portions here are out of control). We had the spinach dip and the potato skins....it was good, but typical bar food. I also had a couple mimosas because they were on special for 1$....heck yes! We then got our soup/salad bar. I had the soup and it was good, nothing terribly special, but not bad. Then the (humongous) entrees....I had the lamb chops and they were delicious! They were perfectly cooked and seasoned....super juicy, they reminded me of eating lamb chops at home as a kid....definitely delicious. The BF had the new york strip which was equally good. He got it medium well, and they managed to keep it moist and juicy....awesome! We all got twice baked potatoes with our meals, which were very good (how can potato and cheese and bacon and whatnot be bad?). We finished with mud pie, which was ok, but nothing special. Anyway, at the end of the meal (while I was sitting there dying of stuffedosity) the owner came over and spent the time to chat with us about how our party was going to be set up and what the room would look like. I liked how friendly and accommodating the owner was. We are planning to have our rehearsal dinner, so I will update after that! Definitely check this hidden treasure out!

r0V-WUXiJtYsw7zlvtGqsg.text: I live in Glendale, and my girlfriend and I were on the east side to take care of some business. We got hungry at about 4:00 pm, and decided to find a local place to sit down and have food that wasn't at Denny's or fast food. We settled on Feeney's. It is one of those hole-in-the-wall places, but it is quite elegant inside. Outside appearance is certainly deceiving.   I will not review ambiance or time, nor will I compare foods with each other, because we went after lunch rush and before dinner rush and have only eaten there once. We cannot rate what they are best for, or what days are easiest or funnest because we ate on a Thursday between lunch and dinner and were pretty much the only diners at that time (which was awesome!). I ordered the half-rack pork ribs, with a side of baked potato and salad bar. She ordered the salisbury steak with a side of sweet potato fries and salad bar.  Establishment: As you walk in, you are greeted warmly. Their color theme is dark, matching the stone walls and dim lighting. It is pretty cozy, so it is not a place I would recommending taking rowdy kids. Besides, there isn't really a kid's menu. The bar is off to the right, and the dining is throughout. They do have a nice foyer for busier times, I guess. There are about 4-6 televisions throughout, with HD programming. One downside is that the patio for the smokers is in the front, but nothing can really be done to change how that is, except for moving to a new building. It is kind of secluded, so you may not have to worry about the smells. Parking is kind of small. You might have a hard time parking your limousine, but there is plenty of it. Just check it out on Google Satellite.   Salad bar: I always love the salad bars when I go to the buffet, mainly because they have all the fixin's. Feeney's is not a buffet, but hey! theres a salad bar! This one is pretty awesome, and yes, it has all the fixin's, even jello (which I found interesting). The ranch dressing is made in-house, and it is oh-my-god delicious, as ranch goes. Very sweet tasting. The only discrepancy I have with this salad bar is that it is mostly just dinner salad lettuce (iceberg) mixed in with a little romaine. I think it would be cool if they can offer some variety, like spinach, or spring mix. All the salad bar products are chilled and sneeze guarded.   Entree: The pork ribs were pretty good. They pour on the barbecue sauce, and it is thick and tangy. The meat is fall-off-the-bone tender, but I can say that mine was a little too dry; not dry enough to send back, but maybe overcooked by about 30-45 seconds. The barbecue sauce made up for it though. My baked potato was cooked to perfection. I did find it convenient that you can get any toppings for your baked potato at the salad bar. Our hostess gave us a small sample bowl of the Soup of the Day, to share, as both of us ordered the salad bar. We thought that was a nice gesture. My lady's salisbury steak came with brown gravy sauce and sauteed mushrooms and onions. She said the flavor was great, and the toppings were just right. This is not your Banquet frozen dinner salisbury. It is very hearty and juicy. The only complaint she had was that it was a little too seared on the bottom (heat a little too high in the skillet when cooked). Like my ribs, it was not enough to send it back, because the flavor was very good. This isn't Hell's Kitchen, after all. She also liked her sweet potato fries; she had them with the ranch dressing.  Customer Service: The customer service here was great. It was easy to talk to the hostess and waitress. They greeted us with a smile, and were very sociable. They really went above and beyond to make sure that our visit was top notch.   Recommendation: My girlfriend and I would definitely eat here again when on the east side. Price is okay. I do not eat anything too fancy anywhere I go (I am a student), but entrees range from $10 for the sandwiches, salads and chicken all the way to about $30 for the beef wellingtons and seafood. I think the only fault with the building is that the smoking area is in the front, so you have to walk by the smokers to get in, but it isn't like they can demo the building and make a new one. Small downside. When we went there, it was just some old men chewing the fat, smoking their cigars. I am giving them 4 stars just based on the slightly overcooked food, but that may change with time, I suppose.

RWBnNymhGLA_5m93AkI7yA.text: Had a great night here with my boyfriend and new friends. First time and it was amazing. Food and service was above and beyond what I expected. The place is out of the way and looks dodgy from the outside but very warm and pleasant on the inside. Kinda pricey but worth it.  We tried the London Broil and it was tender and well seasoned. Also had a "Envious Passion" martini....it was radioactive green and was sensational!  I recommend this place for anything from hanging out with friends or family to a romantic dinner. Well worth it.

Q0SCX16T1rlFbUyrLp7UyA.text: My boyfriend and I found this place while searching for a restaurant that serves Beef Wellington.  We went for dinner tonight and I can say this is our new favorite spot.   We started with Calamari which was good. It came with 2 sauces, a cocktail sauce and a chunkier tomato sauce which I loved.    I had the Wellington and my boyfriend had the sirloin and shrimp. The Wellington was fantastic! so juicy and the gravy was rich and delicious. My boyfriend likes his steak "Black and blue" which is not common and usually when he orders it that way it comes out too done. The chef came out and asked him how rare he would like the middle and when it came it was perfect. His steak also came with 2 gigantic shrimp that were sweet and tender.   We finished with Creme Brulee that was very creamy but not overly sweet. (Which for me is a good thing!)  The prices were very good. We basically had a 4 course meal for about 90.00 and everything was wonderful! We will be going back and the sooner the better.

TuuOl6heLTSgIMQQFCfqmQ.text: Great food.   Even better service.   Lamb chops must be ordered Greek style.  Made my family feel like their family.   Even went out to find me matches for a birthday cake.   You'd be a fool to skip this restaurant.

6ggxGzblazUolCRK4FvgFA.text: Salad bar was small,not many choices,but the ingredients were fresh and tasty. Sirloin burger was ok,bun bigger than the burger,bun was drab,toppings were small and wilted,French fries were sparse and partially raw. Once a bigger party came in,our waitress "dropped" us--ignored us. It was my birthday and kind of disappointed with whole experience,won't go back. 13 north should of been my first choice,wanted to try something new...oh well. Definitely nothing special.

OKaKsKfi4zUkEe4oZG3MZg.text: Maria was so approachable and friendly.  Our group ordered the calamari , prime rib and a wonderful mud pie for dessert.  Great atmosphere and good food

qVGxVCXYdkoDfgZ-SCov_A.text: Best Prime Rib Ever! I've been around the country and the world. This little whole in the wall homely restaurant has THE BEST Prime Rib! You have to go to the little gem!

D91vSH8dblQCAUmYzDNDHQ.text: Brought two newbies with me this time. As always great service coupled with great food. Prime rib was perfect with the baked potato prepared with slight crunch to skin. One diner said best prime rib in the valley. The other dining partner commented that the filet was perfectly cooked and would be back for another visit... Two new patrons .. Thx Feeney's

Y-nguyRF4nkh7lbU5yhRfw.text: Searched yelp for a Father's Day prime rib treat and found this spot and decided to give it a chance . Upon walking to the salad bar I noticed an open grill that had some sausages searing and putting out a pleasant Aroma . I felt I had made a good choice ..The Prime rib was on point along with the baked potato and salad . I will definitely be back to explore some more dishes .

sRDDqUDX6pUIbr3VP5aBcQ.text: Read a number of good reviews here on this establishment. Last night, my friend and I had a hankering for prime rib so we decided to try Feeney's.  We arrived and were seated promptly. Drink orders were taken. Iced tea only (my friend has been on the wagon over 25 years!!). Small glass, but was constantly refilled. Ordering was no problem. My friend ordered the small cut of prime rib (approx 10 oz) and a baked potato w sour cream and chives. I ordered the "Feeney's Cut" (the largest, approx 24 oz) of prime rib with rice pilaf. Dessert was fried ice cream. There is complimentary salad bar. Warm rye and pumpernickel breads and butter come with the dinners.  Maybe the kitchen was having an off night. Maybe the vendor supplied substandard beef. Maybe the refrigeration was screwed up. I don't know. Let's start with the salad bar. All the usual fare: mixed iceberg lettuce, carrots, 3 bean salad, cottage cheese, cici beans, bacon bits, red onions, croutons, etc. There were four kinds of salad dressings, including ranch, russian and creamy italian. The ingredients were fresh, especially the lettuce. However, the salad bar itself was mildly cool, not cold. Otherwise the salad bar, in my experience, is nothing special.  The prime rib orders arrived as we ordered them: medium rare. Small plastic cups of horseradish sauce and au jus were on the plates. My rice pilaf was starchy and stuck together. My friend's baked potato was underdone. After trimming off 20% of the meat because one end was all fat and gristle, both orders were a tad dry. There was no rub on the exterior; no salt, no cracked peppercorns, nothing. The prime rib is really nondescript. The fried ice cream dessert was well executed.  The service was good. The iced tea server (that's all he does, apparently) was working overtime. I'd like to give this restaurant 2.5 stars because I find nothing about this restaurant particularly outstanding. They served us perfectly average fare.

4wuJY4UtgQaAP1kzu6xgRw.text: We love this place.........we come here especially for the Prime Rib, and the awesome salad bar - who else has this anymore??!!  Always amazing, always delicious........best little late-night gem we've found in a long while.

kiHH8cdiVZumUA2Pewx2tw.text: I have always enjoyed going to Feeneys, for their great food, nightly specials and to enjoy drinks with friends on their patio. Now after the resent renovations, the fresh look , and atmosphere makes Feeneys my favorite place for dinning and drinks.

F_NOXlf78s8Ox_uKCJW_1g.text: The decor immediately catches your eye. It's very inviting, yet with a vintage feel. You definitely feel either a time warp or a country warp. We really liked it. Gave us a free app for checking in on Yelp. I started with the salad bar, then got ribs, a double baked potato and veggies. It was good. The double baked potato was amazing. They brought us a free dessert. The staff was friendly, the restaurant was clean and the prices weren't too high. I would for sure go back.

dSkJKg7XLrw7iLSfFkrMRA.text: Thought it was a dive bar until I read the yelp reviews. Definitely not a dive bar. Phenomenal prime rib!!

atueQn0mraZge0K1pa3zqw.text: We just enjoyed our Christmas company party there for the third year in a row. Everyone loved their selection for dinner. For a small place, they handled our service for 18 nicely. Thanks to all!

G-FNeUMTlup_HaQ4P9i63A.text: I genuinely cannot believe I haven't reviewed Feeney's. I look back at my reviews and it's like I'm emerging from a fog. A year flew by and I didn't review anything. I could have sworn I had reviewed Feeney's. So big a part has Feeney's played in my life this past year, it's like I've never NOT gone to Feeney's.   The first time I went to Feeney's was like every time I go to Feeney's. I marvel at its bald-faced lack of pretension. This is a restaurant by and for people who remember what restaurants used to be like before chains became the norm and non-chains realized they were special and started becoming overpriced poor-value destinations (cough-Durants-cough).   If you grew up in the 70s or 80s, you will instantly recognize this place. Dingy without being dirty, all dark woods and low ceilings and Irish village frescoes. At first, you will wonder how it could possibly have stayed in business while maintaining this look, because most of the places that looked like this flatly could not keep up with changing tastes and increasing demands for quality and flair. Then you eat and you realize the truth: Feeny's keeps it simple with can't-miss old-school standards and top notch preparation and quality.  It starts with the salad bar. That's right - that relic of the 70s and 80s where you are told you are welcome to go ahead and serve yourself while you wait for your dinner to be prepared. Not well stocked enough to be a meal on its own (which is as it should be), the salad bar is the perfect appetizer. What's there are all the standards for a competent salad, is fresh, delicious and even the dressings taste home made. If it starts with the salad bar, it finishes with a flourish with the entrees. Real deal steaks and seafood, prepared simply and competently. I always get the prime rib. In fact, the reason we found Feeney's was because I was in the mood for a prime rib and we went looking for one locally. I was not disappointed. Perfectly prepared with a side of au jus and creamed horseradish, if you like prime rib, you will be intimately familiar with its presentation here.   I should mention that the service has never been anything short of top-notch. Even at their busiest, we receive constant, uninvasive attention from the host, waiters and other staff.  In short, if you're looking for a homey independent throwback that has class-A food and service at reasonable prices, give Feeney's a try, you'll love it. I know we do.

dFuDmDC18nDo5KPaFv3rlQ.text: Really bad truck stop salad bar and the quality of food not good, beef Wellington over cooked meat and doughy pastry

q6pfmEnlTkRNjxTNHgjfRg.text: As some one who before moving to Phoenix did not like going out , this place has really made me feel at home. I walk in the door and I get plenty of Hello's and good conversation. I recommend this place to everyone that I can. niSlfAF18UjBc22St240Tw.text: Old school yo!  We're talking salad bar with beets, sunflower seeds and cottage cheese yo!  We're talking prime rib of Flintstonian proportions!   I met a group of good friends here recently. We were seated in a back (non window) room and my claustrophobia almost got the best of me. It was a pretty tiny room. Soon I decided it wasn't tiny. It was cozy. And soon the Coronas were a- comin' and the conversation was flowing.  Our server, a delightful woman, was efficient and friendly. And a shout out to her just for handling a group of a dozen or so yelpers! Can you imagine waiting on us lol!?!?  My prime rib and baked potato were pure perfection. The salad bar was fresh and fully loaded.   Much like myself towards the end of the evening.  The decor is all muraled-out if memory serves me. So there's a lot going on!   So Feeney's you got a new fan! Great place to take my folks, out of towners or anyone I think is worthy of the Feeney charm!!!  Yo!

BEAguZwNwKZD4MSuo4os-w.text: Hello, Phoenix history! This was the second location of the Cork N' Cleaver chain. Back when there was a Cork N' Cleaver chain. And not much has changed since.  In my mid 20's I lived around the corner and was in quite often. Never had a bad meal. Granted - I never had a GREAT meal - but it was never bad.  I moved away - then I moved back. While I am certainly not a regular - some of the specials are just too hard to pass by. Monday is CenPho is cheap burger night. $4 for burger and fries at Feeney's and Maizies, $5 at Vig and Vig Uptown. My mom's husband is not a big fan of Maizie's decor, so we have been frequenting Vig Uptown. I talked them into Feeney's last week - and it was a great trip down memory lane. Each of us went for the $4 burger special, and we each elected to add on the salad bar for $2.50.  Nothing exceptional - it was a standard, good quality burger. Nothing flashy or showy - nothing you wouldn't have seen when they opened this location in 1965. And it still works. Well.   Specials other nights of the week include fish & chips, liver and onions, fried chicken, salisbury steak and half rack of ribs - all for $10 each, and all including the salad bar.  Tough to beat that!  In this town, it's not easy to keep an independently owned restaurant open. And keeping one open almost 50 years? Well, I think we can all count on one hand how many places have made that happen.   The food is solid, if not spectacular, the service is always decent, the prices are fair and the portions are good - glad to have Feeney's in my area - it makes me feel like I am part of this town's history - and lets me step back in time a bit.  The advantage of not having updated is when you get inside, it's easy to forget the outside world. You're in a little time warp with a full bar, well executed food and none of the worries of the real world of 2012.

9fahIK-PIfcJM3e5LyYI7Q.text: Ok so I take my wife here because of the reviews.  First I have to say the area is not that great. Second there are people smoking right by the front door on the patio. Now these things dont really bother me to find a really good food spot but this is not it. What it really is, is a bar with food expensive food that tastes like its from The can not fresh.  I did get a free potato skin appetizer for checking in on yelp. But they were not that great. I really wanted this place to be great I ordered the beef wellington med. rare but it was well done and and the gravy and mushrooms were from a can and it taste just like liver. Wow it was gross.  My wife had the same problem but her meat was at least better than mine.  The Salad bar looked like my middle childs salad bar...Terrible,  that should have been our sign to get out but we didn't.   Though I would say the service is nice. But unfortunately We will not be coming here again.  $90 later! Man i was really wanting a Beef Wellington.  Well looks like i will have to try some place else. Update...20 minutes later I threw up. Man I feel like I have been Gipped!

VUHVAvD8j5HDml1fzvKvhQ.text: We are visiting Phoenix and wanted a good steak that didn't break the bank so we went with the good reviews and were not disappointed! Maria is a warm wonderful hostess that made us feel at home and recommended the NY sirloins which were melt in your mouth fantastic! This place is very old school (think Ponderosa) with their chilled plates for the salad bar and dinner rolls but what it lacks in modern decor is balanced by the perfectly cooked steaks and fantastic service. I even got a hug on the way out from Maria, this is exactly what the hubby & I needed so five stars for food & service.

sqvBJdVK7Vr-Wks2NSY3rw.text: Absolutely amazing staff! Food was delicious, especially the beef wellington. Our glasses were full the entire time. Can't wait to come back.

2CjI7JX4pJMIMdiqizVd7A.text: I went to this restaurant, the food was priced expensive, $26-$48! I don't mind paying for that if the food is that great, this was not... yx5gbSnXQSpTGAK4_15dRg.text: AWESOME steakhouse, and coming from me that is quite a compliment.  I don't order prime rib out because so many places it just isn't that good, and I never order steaks out because I know how to grill them awesome at home. BUT I would gladly order either at Feeneys! Matter of fact, they are my gold standard for prime rib!  Super friendly service, comfortable but very nice ambiance, nice neighborly bar area, and an awesome salad bar. Lots of great specials, I think it is Tuesdays that you can get their angus burger for $5.   Best beef spot in town, great place to impress a date!

9-2vwusukNzt7Q0qgcCnhg.text: Man!!! I LOVE Yelp!!!!  I was craving for a nice juicy rib eye and found Feeney's through Yelp.  I got there on a Wednesday night around 6pm and it wasn't too crowded so I was able to get a table right away.  It looks like this restaurant also has some Greek items.  For example they serve Saganaki (Flaming cheese with pita bread), if I was with another person, I would totally order it because I love this dish. They also serve Hummus and Pasta Mykonos (linguini with feta cheese, chopped tomatoes and chives in a garlic butter sauce).    I was very tempted to order the Greek items but I came here for the Prime Rib.  So I ordered the following: Ace Pineapple Hard Cider ($5.45) - Pineapple Beer.... No need to describe how good was this beer. Potato Skins (Free if you Check In) - Lots of cheese, bacon, sour cream and green onions.  What an awesome combination!!! Feeney's Famous Prime Rib 8oz ($21) - The meat melted in my mouth.  I ordered it medium rare, it was tender, juicy and flavorful.  So much meat for just $21.  I got it with a build your own side salad and baked potato.  They had to wheel me out of the restaurant. LOL :) :)   I can't wait to go back to Feeney's.  My mouth is watering just by writing this review.

JS_kp8T7SItnchyxofIRCw.text: I started coming here 7-8 months ago, after "discovering" it on my lunch hour. Since, I've been happy to have many wonderful meals and meet the great unique and diverse folks that frequent here.  You can't go wrong with the prime rib sandwich - it's my fave. My partner swears by the gyro. The twice baked potatoes are the size of an infant. Burger Monday's are super popular and the shrimp in a cocktail or scampi are huge and delicious.  Brunch is fantastic, just enough choices and the ability to mix and match to suit your needs.  Service is great. Expect to be greeted by both the people on the patio and once you get inside with a smile. The decor is old school and very homey. It's like going to your cool aunt's house for a meal.   Stop in alone, and you'll never be treated like a stranger.

9Fhy84dIvEr7sEI84_TaHQ.text: Feeney's is a great locals place that has been around for years. I only started going there a couple of years ago and had probably missed out for a long time.   When walking in, you are immediately greeted by one of the very friendly family members. We had a party of five and made a reservation on Open Table (I think all restaurants should be on Open Table by the way). Right away we were taken back to our table. Feeney's is small with several small rooms of tables so I would recommend making a reservation for any size party.   We placed our drink order, margarita for me, martinis or beer for my friends. They serve about 100 types of bottled beer and have a few on draft. This is when I made my check in on Yelp and was awarded a free potato skin appetizer. Why not!?  When our server returned with the drinks I mentioned our free appetizer. He said, "I saw you check in, I've already ordered it for you."  Nice!  For the main event three of us had the prime rib, one had the ribeye and one had fish and chips. From what she was saying, the ribeye was outstanding, she could not have been happier with it. I was told that the fish and chips was also very good. As for our prime rib, it was good but needed a little boost in flavor. Still it was a beautiful cut of meat and tender. I was the only one who had been to Feeney's before and have only had the prime rib, so obviously it was normally outstanding. As I said, the prime rib had always been good in the past, it was probably just one of those not so flavorful slabs of meat that the restaurant received. I will return and I will order the prime rib again!   Let me back up to the choices that come with entrees. Salad bar or soup and your choice of side item. I opted for the salad bar as I always do when dining there. It's a nice little salad bar with several choices of toppings. They also have several choices for your side item with a small up charge for a large twice baked potato ($2). It's very worth it!  I am not a dessert person normally, but I always get one there. The mud pie!  Coffee ice cream, Oreo cookie crust and chocolate topping. Mmm! Delicious!  All and all this is a fantastic place. Support a local family owned business and check out Feeney's. They also have daily specials!  Enjoy!

Feeneys is always my go to watering hole for any celebration, great for small groups or large parties.

tOkDftNYFNbU-jhHAG1vmw.text: Service was AMAZING. Tasty food. A family owned joint for sure. Everyone working there made sure we were well taken care of. 10% discount from Yelp. Comped dessert. Lovely conversation. If I'm back this way again I'll be back there.

FvN8CJRCriIsLe08FZcrtA.text: As I was reading the rest of the reviews of Feeney's prior to lodging my own, I realized that I have never been there for the dinner hour! So I can't comment on the lights, candles, and ambience aforementioned.  As Arik mentionined, Crystal is one of the best bartenders I have ever met! She has the best combination of customer service and sassiness that many of us bar regulars love. I've been to Feeney's a few times for drinks, and always had a great experience. They have a really cool patio for smokers as well.   I think the thing I love about this place is that there are so many regular fixtures, presumably from the neighborhood. The times I have been there have been the early happy hour times, and it feels like a neighborhood bar, except the median age of patrons is closer to my parents age than mine. But not in a creepy way.   I have had lunch there once, a few months ago, and it was very fine (3 stars). I had a club sandwich, my other 3 companions had sandwiches as well, and we were all satisfied.   The 4 stars comes from the bar, its patrons, and the bartenders.

GKwMpRk9FKNf8nzco-MpAg.text: This review is long overdue! My husband and I came in one afternoon to grab lunch and we absolutely loved the charm, service and food. My mother in law was coming into town the next week so we thought it would be a great idea to bring the whole family to dinner here. My husband made the reservation but then had to change the day, time and amount of guests multiple times and Judy was the sweetest and didn't blink an eye at all of our changes. She reserved the private room for us and the service and food was amazing again! The young man who helped serve us is so nice and polite even though we had a rather large rowdy group and a cranky toddler. We are future regulars and definitely appreciate how nice and attentive the staff always is. Anyway, the reason I ended up posting this review now is because my husband is still going on about how delicious the pasta bolegnese was weeks later. Thank you!!
