We all ate excellent food (salad bar, soup, chicken marsala, lamb chops, chili, prime rib and delicious sweet-potato fries!) and were treated so nicely by Maria and taken care of so promptly by Sandy and Nester. Maria's son, John, cooks beautifully in the kitchen. Great food and ambiance...don't pass it up!

alI84LeiJ5eXQk8_tkSJ0A.text: Feeney's is the best! I have been going for years and it's always been amazing. The salad bar is always a favorite. It's always fresh and packed with great veggies. The prime rib and the prime rib sandwich are the best I've ever had. I've tried a lot of prime rib at very expensive restaurants and Feeneys is by far the best. The sandwich bun is so soft and so delicious. The meet cooked perfectly at medium rare. I can't say enough about this place, the food, the service, the owners are all amazing. It's like your neighborhood Cheers where everyone knows your name, but the food is amazing to match!

y7kEALRQi75lVJa7LYmPew.text: This place was old school when it old school was in session.  I can't spot any changes since it was one of the original Cork N' Cleavers - maybe new carpet, but that may be it.  The salad bar is so old school, it still has jello - not jello shots - jello.  And since, I'm old school, I'm a fan of the salad bar.  Monday 4 buck burgers with 2.50 salad bar is the only food you'll require for the whole day.  Decent burger too.  Good barkeeps - they remember your name or call you hon (old school).  The food is pretty basic, but they start with decent ingredients and prepare them well.  Had the prime rib a couple of weeks ago and my view is that the only way to eat prime rib is to have it breath it's last on the way from the kitchen to the table.  It was early enough in the evening that they were able to deliver a tasty hunk of meat that was as requested.  If you're into modern, contempo kinds of joints, Feeney's won't be for you - but if you're in the mood for dark, old school, slightly seedy (in a good way) - then Feeney's  might just fit the bill.

8A6EiBEFifGAf6_z7nktug.text: Some of the best prime rib around (usually).  The salad bar is amazing too...  They have a $4 burger Monday now too, which really gets the place packed.  Really good date place I'd say except for Mondays when it is packed full of people eating cheap burgers.  Really quality local restaurant all around.

cd8Uv6ns9TzuMJ0hQJ15Yg.text: A old phoenix institution.  At one time this place was known as the cork and Cleaver.  Food is excellent, I had the Philly Cheese Steak.  I have not had one this good since I left the East Coast when i was there for school.  Great place to have some beers with friends and watch sports.

a2HrYZQkPef81uUdyy8Qjw.text: Very good old school Steak restaurant that reminds me of how they used to be when I was a kid. It is kind of nice to see that a few places like this are still around. The prices are reasonable and the food is good. The service is superb. The best part is they serve dinner till 10 pm. My only complaint was the steaks are cooked a little more well done than most places so order it a bit less done than usual.

NKUC1hGssTFnfPGV2kE6sg.text: Great place, very friendly and welcoming, excellent food.  Frankly it is one of my favorite steak houses in town, in part because the quality of the meat is excellent and the price is reasonable.  The decor is rustic and reminds me of the steak houses my dad loved when I was a kid.  You pay for good food and excellent service, not for glitz.  That's just how I like it.

x62IKGd0NnvE52EZHCbz0A.text: $4 dollar burger special Monday nights! Beer and drinks are a bit overpriced, but the week night specials are worth it.

cIZgVpPBVLGs5VMz9qQYag.text: Great Monday special (cheeseburger & fries). Customer service always good. Owner even checks in with patrons.

4GCbxuXygX_GYUJAxFSrgQ.text: So, tonight we went to Feeny's. This is usually a great place, but lately they have fallen down on the job.   It's not the food, which is great, but the bar.  Exorbitant drink prices.  This is Central Phoenix, not Scottsdale. Short pours and watery drinks are not what I expect.  And a cocktail waitress who doesn't listen.  Very disappointing.   It will be a while before we go back.

eZASlWX-SQJ0k4v74gXRyA.text: Decided to go here for dinner last week. I have driven by many times and saw the great reviews on Yelp. Our waitress who is also the owner was so welcoming and helpful.  I ordered an end-cut piece of prime rib and the salad bar. Nice selection of fresh salad items and salad. The prime rib was excellent, actually the best piece I've had since moving to Arizona in 1981. Would definitely go back again!

fPxkd_xbtXD5QfaLMBmGgw.text: We ordered our food, it was bland nothing had flavor and the price was outrageous. The service was horrible we never got asked to have our drinks refilled  We will not be coming back

XxI2RdYbCZK95gfQb8_Z_g.text: This place is walking distance from me, I went in once but it took nearly 20 minutes to get a glass of water and a menu, at that point I walked out, maybe they were short handed. Went back again and it was not to busy, order the world famous prime rib and sadly I have to say I wasn't really impressed. The grilled shrimp and the au jus sauce were pretty good but the steak just lacked everything and it was cold, I was to hungry to wait another 15 minutes for another steak and clearly that can't re-heat the one I have. Maybe down the road I will give it another try.

9woU41B3ZPxBDY582kK5pw.text: Secret of the neighborhood  Friendly staff***** great prime rib***** Salad Bar***** great value******  Great classic Steak place recommend *************************************

pPuJKaTOR7MlE0kdP0Q9cg.text: Feeneys is the quintessential neighborhood gem spot that only the locals know about. They create a vibe of family and friendliness to ALL PATRONS who enter their door. A lot of restaurants in valley SHOULD go here and see what REAL CUSTOMER service looks like.   That paragraph rant and I haven't even gotten to the best part. The FOOD. From the old school salad bar to their legendary prime rib; Feeney's get it RIGHT. Not to mention it one of the few surviving places that still serves up properly cooked Liver & Onions (my wifes favorite), Beef Wellington, and Lamb Chops.

AESdNPoa2Soo5CQb2QshgA.text: I'm so happy I stumbled upon this gem!  I had driven by a few times on my way home and decided to stop in for a drink.  The bar is small and full of life.  The same regulars have been warming the stools for years and they have the crazy dynamic going on that's so entertaining.  As soon as I sat down the bartender introduced me to everyone and they treated me like one of the gang from there on.    To eat I've had the filet mignon and burger - both were full of flavor and cooked perfectly to my specifications.  Everyone you encounter at this place is so warm and friendly, you want to keep coming back!

BYFk5ug-UbNhlkUqjBCxJA.text: Back for meal two...salisbury steak..on special  and really good!!  This place is sooo awesome.  Great ambiance..amazing beer selection and always great and friendly service!! Will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy Creme Brule&#39;...love this place

E6j7ODD3ZXcOtnFAA-ye4w.text: The people were incredibly friendly all the way down to the cooks. Food was good, but not great for the price point. The kids loved the French fries. We had the prime rib and teriyaki top sirloin, both medium rare. Ended up sharing the sirloin as it was much better out of the two. We also enjoyed the salad bar.

u_OD_-Ki9AZH-vyRbBpw1A.text: Other reviews said they had a great salad bar so my  girlfriend and I went there on Mother's Day just for a nice salad. Not sure who felt it was great but we found it looked average and decided to go elsewhere and left. Restaurant looked nice and regular menu a bit pricey so overall we can only comment on the looks of their salad bar. Go to Ruby Tuesday if you only want a well stocked salad bar for decent money.

oKZzzo6WwBgXwC_-vrJfIA.text: I love Feeney's.  The place is the best kept secret in Phoenix.  I'm bringing the family here next time they visit.

DvSyB08XUoO-dVIGARDh3Q.text: This little gem just got better with the upgrades they have brought Feeney's into this century with class. The food is still very good and done well to each customer's preference. They have some unique items other places do not. It is the best service and we love the owners and staff.

qZO_60488b2n0isQS_NdIA.text: Awesome food best service ever! Oh my the prime rib I have left overs for tomorrow! I recommend the twice baked potato! Treated just like family will be back!

f3CKQsevIeVCnAj9kbW3Rg.text: The potato skins were yummy! My Feenies burger was pretty good, although I tend to like my burger a little messier. The staff there was extremely accommodating and nice

b9PTe70oaxYFx3luEi440Q.text: Just had the worst prime rib I have ever tried. Went for dinner at 7 with my gf. There where a lot of people enjoying dinner. Service was pleasant . Ordered the prime rib with veggies and salad bar. Prime rib looked properly served as med rare. I tried it by its self then with the horseradish and Au jus . The meat Didn't have the taste or texture I find appealing . Bottom of the meat had a slimy appearance that resembled bad meat . Maybe I just caught em on a bad night. Needless to say it was a 60$ donation. I won't be back

kl5Lh90Hdue4EKylL9gl8g.text: Love that is the same, haven't been here in years, excellent. Had the ribeye. This app is pissing me off forcing me to write more than I wanted to

9dqihHHs_z_kpxl-N1uXDQ.text: probably one of my favs!  Escargot is amazing, loads of voices for small plates. The roast beef with herb cheese bruschetta is like a small sandwich of goodnessSince this is a neighborhood place for me I frequent often with my friend. Never a disappointment this STAFF is fabulous! Judy And Amanda never stop smiling and they HUSTLE to get your order in. Their prime rib and seafood is deliciously prepared!   go for happy hour but definitely stay for dinner!

Z3Z5Dnl-R0WvfBQ-8hXU7w.text: My bf and I came here for Valentine's Day and we're very happy we did! We chose the salad bar since tomato soup was the only option that night (neither of us are big on tomato soup). We were slightly bummed because we knew how typical salad bars are. Well we thought we knew! Feeney's salad bar is so fresh and delicious though! They also offer potato salad and macaroni salad which was an awesome bonus. Next we ordered fried zucchini. BEST fried zucchini we both have ever had! Melt in your mouth buttery, without being soggy nor undercooked. For our main dishes I got the filet mignon (butterfly cut, well done) with mashed potatoes and my bf got a huge ribeye (medium well) with fries. My entree was on the smaller side but so filling and juicy even though Maria (the owner and sweetest lady ever!) cringed when I ordered it well done lol. My bf's entree was humongous and he had to throw in the towel about 2/3 of the way through it. We both loved our entrees! Only downfalls were the wait time for our meal and that they weren't offering twice baked potatoes that night. But it was a holiday so it makes sense! We will definitely be back again:)

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Tf4PUuHNwCPE6kS2WBG6Kw.text: Decided to celebrate our new Phoenix home by visiting Feeney's. The pork osso bucco was the best I ever had and my husband said the liver and onions was as good as his mom's (very high praise)!   We will definitely be back to this wonderful place. We are looking forward to becoming regulars.

cBOXDwJOi6FaGfafAY721g.text: Woah. Not often I get treated as more than just a regular dude. I usually don't mind that, because I'm as regular as dudes can get, but Feeney's treated me like a king. Or sultan. Sultan sounds better.   The servers are fun and they clowned with each other. I like people who love what they do. We ordered the Saganaki as an appetizer, which is this plate of awesome melty cheese you eat with pita bread. That was the best thing I have ever eaten. Then the waitress comes out and she all "Hey do you guys want a bottle of wine on the house?" Well, hell yes we would. And so there we were, full bottle of a delicious red blend, 8oz steaks and a delicious appetizer in our bellies.   Might not sound like much, but Feeney's nailed it with me and my girlfriend. You guys have indeed earned another pair of regulars.

jObwfIEbmUGtdkjZ1DLeIg.text: Very cool little place. Staff was very friendly, service was great, rib eye was so-so. Unsure if I just got a bad piece of meat or what. I'll consider going again simply because George was a great bartender. Maybe next time I'll try the prime rib.

jLeCWbHfYBkKVlrHsRhALg.text: One of our favorite steak places! We love going here for the prime rib, steaks and the salad bar. The wait staff is so friendly and courteous and the food they provide is delicious!

l9m-xL92IuPwczu-l374mQ.text: Really like the atmosphere here. Seems like a really cool place. The food overall was good. Twice baked potato was huge and loaded. Salad bar was awesome! I ordered the 16 oz prime rib. It was perfectly cooked but unfortunately kind of bland. I'm a big aus jus person and it was also very bland. Overall the prime rib was OK but not as flavorful as I'm used to. Id be willing to try it again, could have been a one off.

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 16 oz prime rib with a stuffed potato.

_14j2yzZUqKH4pICuU-wmA.text: I don't want to say that it's a given that a restaurant that has Greek owners is excellent, but if you add in that they have a salad bar and a char-broiler,  that percentage of it being a given goes to "near-lock". The service is top notch, the atmosphere is great, and then the food. I've had the prime rib, the pork chops, and the Salisbury steak. Cooked to order Salisbury steak! Just go. It's so goood.

OzTgEOGWm68kdc9igq6BPA.text: What a find!  We dropped in for a late lunch and George took care of us. The atmosphere reminded me of a better version of Monti's steakhouse in Tempe with rustic brick walls and al fresco scenic murals in each room  The food was divine. I ordered the London broil in a sweeter mushroom sauce and my spouse had the French Dip.  The quality of meat was top notch and we both practically licked our plates towards the end. If my stomach could have handled it, I would have ordered seconds.  This place is located just south of Maryland on 12th Street with simple access and plenty of parking.  We will no doubt be back again.  Our service was excellent as well, but oh wow the food!!

0P8LpugMEbnEKuBce9ZDDw.text: Great atmosphere, terrific food. I had the filet medallions topped with Gorgonzola sauce over mashed potatoes and it was wonderful. I ordered the steak medium rare and it was cooked to perfection. The wine was wonderful and the cheesecake delicious. Highly recommended!

63yYDW7zZJ2AF6M0k8Ch6g.text: After a disappointing visit some time ago, I decided to give this place another chance, this time during happy hour. The appetizer of okra was unseasoned and not coated in corn meal as it should be. The dipping sauces of watery ranch and runny ketchup were uninspired. We also ordered the bratwurst appetizer. We were brought polish sausage. The accompanying cheese sauce had a weird, lumpy foamy texture. It barely tasted like cheese. The other sauce was bbq. Weird. No flavor. Sad. We left after one drink. Oh, and the drunks on the patio were extremely drunk and annoying, and their cigarettes stank. Old school is not always the best. Bland food. Sorry looking salad bar. No thanks.

0tPCuuGgKZW21OCQ51bDTQ.text: Great food! First time going there last night and will definitely return! The Filet was super tender and juicy all the way through and the twice baked potato... OMG! I couldn't finish it! I had to bring it home. Super friendly and attentive staff. Great find!

q1gaaZCYYnZKBcP3gnzP1Q.text: Great place to go for lunch......I've never been there for dinner, but the daily lunch specials are great.  Try the London Broil with mashed potatoes.....excellent!

-TWhi893r-j8K6CPi72jgw.text: I had heard great things about Feeny's and I was excited to try it! It is definitely a dive bar type scene, which is awesome because you can be comfortable and not have to worry about proper dining etiquette    It took a little while to get service in the bar's dining area, however, once we got service, our drinks came promptly. Ordering food took another hot minute and when we got our so told famous prime rib, we were a tad disappointed. My date got the smaller prime rib and I got the biggest option (more protein, right?). I also opted to pay the extra charge for the twice baked potato. While the food was good, my prime rib came out cold. I had to send it back to be reheated because it seemed like I had reheated it in a microwave. When I got the prime rib back, it was hot, juicy, and amazing! Side note, the salad bar was classic, fresh, and awesome!   All-in-all, I would come back, but I wouldn't sit in the bar area and try to enjoy an entree style dinner. The service was exceptionally lacking9' that area. The food was good, but you have to be assertive if your food isn't up to par with the prices they are charging.

B2vo7VsrN477pgizSdAO5g.text: Unbelievable!! Picked this place out of the blue. This family owned business provides phenomenal service, tag team service, and the most phenomenal food you have ever tasted. I will recommend this to any of my friends, family, and anybody looking for the local flavor of a good steak and amenities, to include ambience that you could look for.

irY8fhORSOfILh6OaGMFoA.text: My fIrst dining experience at Feeney's. We had lunch. After reading reviews I opted for 8 oz prime rib served with potato or rice side and soup or salad. I chose mashed potatoes with gravy and salad bar.  Salad bar included fresh lettuce beets, garbanzo beans, carrots and cucumbers, black olives, red onion, etc. etc. served on a frozen pewter salad plate. yum!  Homemade coleslaw, potato and macaroni salads too. Salad dressings are all homemade. Blue cheese dressing was so delicious. The prime rib was an excellent piece of meat in every way--flavorful and tender.  The owner Maria, served us and she is extremely cordial. Looking forward to bringing my husband with me next time.

4XDb1IsVYHaKvhQR94jWQw.text: Checked this place out last night while in town for some Spring Training Baseball. I called for a reservation for a party of 6 and was very glad I did as the place was busy. They seated us promptly in a small area cramped with 4 tables. If anyone had to get up from the table, literally 2 people had to move to let them person out. We all ordered drinks and the server had my husband accompany her to the bar because she didn't know what type of bourbon they had! It took awhile for someone to take out order (they use a group approach at service, with different people doing different jobs). Most of us opted for the salad bar, which was really good. We ordered several different entree's including the Lamb Chops, Medallions of Beef, NY Steak and Prime Rib. The Lamb Chops were fatty, the Prime Rib was just OK, not much to say about the Others. Overall my reaction was just kind of Blah, don't think we will come back.

qvzadYa0bVnpP1kZxLgG2g.text: Dark lighting and old school charm interior.  Decent food for take out; lacks presentation but again, this was a 'to go' order. We ordered the Beef Wellington which was good. This is not a high-end restaurant so factor that in when giving it a try. Salad bar had many options and salad items were fresh. Staff was nice and our food was ready to go when we arrived.

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef Wellington and rice
Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Feeney&#39;s Restaurant &amp; Bar

qhjCEwDM3H7ULjaaLE5PZg.text: In from out of town for a graduation at Grand Canyon University and found the place on Yelp.  I had the fish and chips my friend had the liver and onions.  Everything was great.  Wait staff was very friendly!!!  Family atmosphere

1dB0ztCJzQdUQIEW-yjD_w.text: Can't go wrong! Service is ALWAYS friendly. My favorite is Monday night burger special. Burger is cooked to perfection, flavorful and juicy! The salad bar is a nice change and always stocked and clean. The staff is always friendly, talkative and gives you that family feeling of you just walked in to your favorite aunt's house.  My go to place for nights when I don't feel like cooking or driving, as the walk is nice as well.

GnvP1pk-J8WQOMmWZex9BA.text: We took my father out for his birthday here, and we all had a great time and a great meal for the price.  Both the food and ambience at this place are about as traditional American as it gets.  Feeney's is as much bar as restaurant, complete with a smoking porch out front.  That really makes the place unattractive, but it seems like every successful business needs to cater to some special market these days, and I suppose smokers are their niche.  If you like steaks, strong drinks and can overlook the smoker's din of the place, you'll probably enjoy Feeney's a lot.

lbUrXqm3PEZTRWcm9eP-Lg.text: I love this quaint little restaurant. Been here twice! The Beef Wellington is to die for but the tomato soup is the absolute best! Really trust me, it's the best! The owners are so friendly and inviting. Everyone needs to check this gem out!

zUg_kl1FLIg3rk8Bx_SauQ.text: Absolutely LOVE Feeney's!! The entire staff from George to Amanda to Judy are all absolutely amazing!! If you want the best prime rib in the state or a relaxing after work cocktail with some Central Phoenix locals this is definitely the place to be. I have literally never been disappointed with any experience at Feeney's and I highly recommend it to everyone!

OINOrMPPVoGE5XPXNft4Qw.text: No stars!! The reservation I made for my Moms Birthday didnt exist, even though it took him 10 mins. Paking lot is one way in & out, makes no sense. You will get harassed by the drive thru liquor next door, total creep. I get that your family owned, but you need servers. We were ignored for 20 mins.  My sister got an end cut that should be only upon request. No one checked on us. Your too busy with 3 cooks.  You need staff. I was a server for 10 years and you blew it for me on my Moms Birthday. I didnt even want to tip thats how bad it was.  I dont think you care about last night. Good luck. Maybe fix your parking lot, thats a good start. Texas Roadhouse is wayyyy better.

Y4OcU1abSJR0g0POQ9mp9Q.text: This place rocks...it's simply the best neighborhood bar, with the greatest old timers hanging out there. I always enjoy my food, my drinks and the company - no one drinks alone here.  Where else can you find a salad bar from the 70's still up and functioning with bacon bits...  There is a great burger deal on Tuesdays (I think) and they ahve a neat little patio with a TV.

AATnxejDFy0TvWGRp1-hgQ.text: We had our retirement dinner for our father here the other night. We were a party of seven and had a private room of the main dinning room that was perfect for out little celebration. We had checked in with yelp and got one of their free potato skin appetizers as well as an order of calamari and escargot. All were delicious and perfectly prepared escargot and calamari. We have done our research on yelp and wanted to try the prime rib and the liver and onions a couple of their specialties. Our water glasses were never empty the staff was very attentive.  I highly recommend this place if you're tired of the chain and Fox concept nonsense. This should be a local staple if you live in this area. For a party of 73 bottles of wine three appetizers seven dinners and desserts are total bill was 230.00. Wow great vale for excellent service and food!!!!

SReLeK9pNkOoJEaSUJqkDQ.text: One of favorite places for Happy Hour and weekend hangout with friends. Awesome staff/bartenders and friendly environment. Check it out!

Gv12dmOioGGJOXdbrc2TgQ.text: Not so good.  Pricey for what I got.  Salad bar was a bonus, not sure if it justified.

Yj1Sf8SKD5ma-WFQLV72ug.text: Fun, quirky place for a drink and bar food. Great service too.

mw1BoQcbRB63HpDfvt4Vsw.text: Had the filet medallions.   It was totally delicious!  The service was great as well.  The owner greets everyone like they are old friends.

X6AVmUQmeztadadpRor_BA.text: I honestly wish I could give this place 20 stars! Places like this do still exist, and it's awesome! The place itself is almost like being back home, and seeing your loved ones. They welcomed us with open arms, and treated us like family. The food was AMAZING!!!! The owners were AWESOME!!! The wait staff was extremely attentive and made sure we had everthing we needed. Feeneys is to me, a diamond in the ruff. We cannot wait to come back for more!

NZd50_3JUUKzNsHUV0vqDw.text: Five stars for Judy period. Five stars for fish and chips special-  get it. Five stars for cozy ambiance. It is a Phoenix treasure. Its not perfect but some things matter more than others. Great little fireplace at the back.

9T3ib2nCKuMLHNMT1-SZFw.text: Wow! Had the beef Wellington and I can say it was incredibly delicious! Wait staff was very polite and knowledgable. Will be back for sure! No drive could keep that from happening!

GZBkYUBnz2YhQwgr9LVUNg.text: Awesome food...awesome service....and drinks will flow! Take your date or your whole family you will enjoy it  Bill (Chandler)

CnE04c26_QMXTbqXldD2YQ.text: Not bad and not great.  This place is more atmosphere than anything else - it feels like a place you'd bring your grandfather to get a steak, with dim lighting and an old been here 30 years neighborhood bar feel. There's lots of beef on the menu and the food is decent.  I tried the Beef Wellington  - basically a filet mignon cooked into a puff pastry with gravy on top.  It was pretty good, especially the steak, and I kinda wished I'd just ordered the meat on its own.  The gravy was too salty.  All in though, Feeney's is worth trying at least once.

CHUBX5-bwMEKy7Y3ImexKA.text: Before we even walked in we were greeted warmly and then seated right away. The fish tacos we had were delicious definitely the best I've had in arizona. They had a salad bar which had various toppings and tasted great. They had a great selection of beer (according to my boyfriend who is a craft beer enthusiast) and a wine list along with a full bar. All of the waiters and waitresses were extremely friendly and provided excellent customer service. The atmosphere was very welcoming.  I gave this place 5 stars because the food was delicious,the customer service was fantastic, and the atmosphere made you feel right at home. Great for a date night. Definitely going back again.

NPXRPUOVehHJdQxUwtQsEw.text: Atmosphere was great, but the food & service were even better!!! The pork osso bucco was incredible!!!

ZcCgmUUil8hFqACDQJq_Wg.text: This neighborhood restaurant/bar is so excitingly unusual in Phoenix. The food is delicious (definitely try the prime rib), andthe service is unrivaled. This is a family-run throwback to pre-chain takeovers. The salad bar is crisp and fresh. The crowd is friendly. Don't miss this place!

lVvsJKLbKKMW-5ngW92XjQ.text: I've lived a rock's throw away from this joint for over 6 months now, and I didn't even realize the absolute gem that is Feeney's, until this afternoon!  I had heard an excellent review of their salad bar at work from a client, and decided to check it out! The overall feel of the place is welcoming, and up beat!  The dimly lit atmosphere is reminiscent of a dive bar (in a good way), but Feeney's is WAY cleaner and well maintained.  I saw a lot of reviews saying that the vibe was reminiscent of restaurants before major chains were the norm, and where as I may be a little young to remember such a time, I can see what they mean, and agree! Today, I actually decided to stop by to grab a quick salad to go (since I had heard that salad bar was awesome, and it is), but a quick look at their daily special (caramelized apple pork chop, oh em gee AH-MAZING!) and I knew it wouldn't be a salad dinner for me!  The menu has a lot of unique options that you don't see often, including their soup of the day, a Louisiana style seafood soup, london broil and even ESCARGOT!  I can honestly say I've never seen escargot on a menu before!  So I find their menu not only intriguing, but incredibly special!  Some of their dishes are a little on the pricey side, but you certainly get what you pay for, not only in quality and quantity of the food, but also in SERVICE! I myself work in the service industry, and I know how frustrating it can be, but as a result, I hold customer service to a high standard.  Feeney's blew my standards out of the water!  It took only a few minutes to be greeted by Judy, the fabulous bartender, who gave me a lunch and dinner menu to browse through.  I had a few minutes before another gentleman (I'm sad to say I can't remember his name) offered me advice on what to expect from various dishes.  I ended up deciding on the special of the day (that super-delicious caramelized apple pork chop), and a chocolate martini (crafted deliciously by George, co-owner). Both George and Judy were so fantastic to interact with, even going so far as to introduce me to the cooks, and other patrons!  I even left with a bag of grapefruits to take to my co-workers tomorrow and A HUG!  Which is a big deal if you know me, because I'm a hugger!  I've had some pretty awesome customer service in my day, but I can't think of a time or place when I have ever felt so welcome at an establishment I've never been to!  It's clear that the people at Feeney's take pride in their work and I can't wait to go back! From the menu to the staff, Feeney's is a breath of fresh air!  I would recommend this restaurant to ANYONE!

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Slightly consumed chocolate martini- sinfully delicious!

KKNXPe6m5g2iQgZjisLtWA.text: Great meal we had the prime rib and salmon, everything was excellent.  The service was spot on and appreciated.

KO9NdAzVUGH4dxghlMO_VA.text: This is one of those places you'll feel comfortable. The place you want to go to get away from the chain restaurants. There's a patio/ waiting area. Style is old wood and brick. Take a minute to get a drink at the bar, maybe catch a few minutes of the game. There's an adaquate salad bar included with most meals. I tried the full rack of baby backs, no sauce. I can't be sure, but I think their dry rub has a slightly sweet cinnamon base. Ribs weren't quite fall off the bone or really meaty, but they were tasty. I kept getting that cinnamon finish. Next time I'm trying the Prime rib; talking to regular patrons, they recommended it.

j57wE3MhRpbi6mhL0E3khw.text: Diamond in the rough!!! Best food I've had in ages!!! Hospitality is out of this world.  Would recommend this to anyone.  Fall off the beaten path and try this place out!

dkw6I-RrHpjGYhzIU3H7DQ.text: Family restaurant with amazing service! The flaming Greek appetizer is beautiful and delicious! The bartender/server Amanda is incredible and always makes sure you are happy and content! The selection of brews is hard to beat!

HPb5Zwtf1kgDfaPufloWNg.text: This place has been on my list for a while. It is a small brick building that is sort of cramped inside. There were a lot of older people at the bar inside and there is also a patio outside you can smoke at. The parking lot was sort of cramped too and they also valet available.  I think I could have made a better selection off of the menu. I ordered a new york strip with a baked potatoes. The steak was very bland; in fact, everyone at my table had ordered a steak and they were all putting A1 steak sauce, salt and pepper on their meat. I was appalled by this because you should be able to eat a steak that costs upwards 20 dollars without having to put A1 or salt on it. Once I was done battling my steak the baked potato I had ordered with it was too cold to enjoy.  The salad bar that came with my meal was good, I don't have anything bad to say about it. The people that ordered soup instead of salad enjoyed theirs. I think this is the wrong place to order a steak from though.  The server was very quirky but did a fine job taking down our orders. Unfortunately when it came time to split the bill she got really confused and a person from our party accompanied her to the register to help her out.  Overall it was not a bad experience. I am willing to give it another shot and try something different off of the menu.

dMTblHbhMER5YbSkt8JbEQ.text: Great cozy restaurant. Food is good especially the salad bar. Top sirloin was good and my husband enjoyed the prime rib. The service was not the best. We were never brought any bread and it took a long time to order another round of drinks. When my beer came, it wasn't cold. All in all, we will return.

n25EItg75yyloBrB_3aJqA.text: I wish I could give Feeney's more stars.   I stopped there tonight to meet for dinner, getting there earlier than my boyfriend I waited at the bar. Within 10 minutes I was having a conversation with the owner Judy, the bartender George and several of the other bar patrons. It felt like somewhere I'd been 100 times before with how friendly everyone was.   George then was our server when my boyfriend arrived. He, the hostess and even the bus boy were prompt and happy to help with whatever we needed.   The food was awesome, to solidify this being our new favorite spot. We got the New York strip steak and prime rib, both cooked to perfection.   I can't say enough great things about every part of our experience and look forward to seeing Judy, George and the gang again soon!

Jjy_zmATb0_VAj0b7QAS5A.text: I'm a foodie, so trust me when I say this place is PHENOMENAL! The ambiance is extremely chill and casual, (you can show up in jeans and a t-shirt), the staff is friendly and attentive, and the food is fantastic. I hadn't had prime rib in a long while, and it was worth the wait to eat it at this hidden gem. The meat was garlicky and flavorful, and so prime I didn't need a knife! I've driven passed it at least a hundred times, and I'm so glad I finally tried it. It's the perfect place for a relaxed evening with incredible food! I'll be returning to try the rest of the menu at least once a month. Thank you for a killer night, Feeny's!

y0r_yQa5aiTnlKxB2gIYcA.text: This restaurant has been our go-to for every Christmas Eve since the late 90's.  How things have changed!  We've always loved the ambiance and the ability to have a family gathering without a lot of hassles, especially on Christmas Eve.  2016 was different.  They had ONE PAGE of a menu for us to choose from, and all of their steak/prime rib prices were about $8-10 over the prices we used to pay.  The three adults ordered prime rib and asked for medium or medium-well -- our prime ribs came still mooing!  in addition, we had our six-year-old grandson with us.  I asked for a KID'S MENU -- they have NONE!!!  There was NO WAY on EARTH I was paying $24.95 for 10-oz. prime rib for a SIX-YEAR-OLD (this was the cheapest  protein on the menu!)  They wouldn't even offer him a hamburger or chicken fingers -- NOTHING -- NO ACCOMMODATIONS WHATSOEVER.  He ended up eating crackers and french fries. For this reason alone, we will not be eating at Feeney's EVER again.

n6tys0o0lzBUSMOji_m2NQ.text: I met two friends at the restaurant who had previously eaten there.  They said it had great food and it was their neighborhood go to place.  They had always had great experiences and so did I.  I ordered the Greek Salad and my friends ordered the Shepherd Pie and the spaghetti.  We all loved the food.  The service is just the right amount of friendly.  They are attentive and seem to be available just when you need them but they do not hover over you.  The prices were in the medium range.  I would definitely go back again.

BTBHzh8KGImQZFTaRnxmRQ.text: This place is awesome!! From the owner, to the staff to other diners! My 2nd time here and Judy remembered us from 6 weeks ago! The food is to die for, the prime rib is just that, PRIME! Location also great at 12th St and Maryland. Can't beat this place!! We'll be back soon for sure!

kGoKcP7DrzgV9wPXs5f5sQ.text: This is a great little hole in the wall.  Apparently theyre categorized as a steakhouse? Whatever. Ive never had a steak there but Ive tried a LOT of the rest of their menu. Delicious. Their reuben is my fave.   I love the atmosphere here. It looks a little fancier than it is. Very chill.  It's actually a great place to watch football on Sundays.  Pro: technically, theyre a Redskins bar.  Con: technically, theyre a Yankees bar.

q9fWZxBz5aKxaJRse9Rn_w.text: Being from Wisconsin we struggle trying to find an awesome Prime Rib in an unpretentious atmosphere. Feeny's hit the mark! Great food and friendly staff! Recommend highly!

Ol-C1pRgLHSvtGG0-OvNwg.text: Despite Nikki Jo M's negative review I think its important to experience feeny's for YOURSELF. I have never given nor heard a poor recommendation when it comes to this place. You will find this establishment has a lot of character to offer which is largly in part why they have so many returning customers. It is True the staff and their clientele have often been compared to the environment of the popular show Cheers because indeed everyone inside is very familiar with one another making for a very comfortable environment. Doesn't matter if its your 100th time or 1st time in Feeny's. For this reason it is always a good time here; whether you're meeting for drinks or dinner. Everyone inside is extremely welcoming and gracious, nothing but good people.   If the people nor the atmosphere is satisfying enough, the food alone makes up for any dissatisfaction. The menu has a wide variety of items including classics as well as new dishes, all delicious! They are known for their salad bar along with their high quality meats, including some of the best prime rib in central Phoenix.   I've been frequenting Feenys for a few months now and will continue to do so as the food along with the people continue to make for a pleasurable experience.   I highly recommend Feeny's to people of all ages and backgrounds.

knYb8w2oy6vt3bg7l4SAWw.text: I have never been here before and my wife decided to take me here for my birthday dinner. I have always wanted to try Beef Wellington ever since I seen it cooked on Hells Kitchen.. And they didn't disappoint. The Wellington was cooked perfectly and the sauce was very flavorful. I would definitely come here again for dinner. A +++ service a nice quiet atmosphere on Sunday perfect for a couple having a quiet romantic dinner.

zcN0sW4bl9lqOAry5f5Iig.text: Two stars because our waiter was so terrific. Neat place on the inside. Food was terrible. - steak overdone - gorgonzola sauce is thick brown grave made from a mix - no gorgonzola inside. Very expensive for what you get - so disappointing.

HM4SdsPh--etZwVtXN49dw.text: This is obviously a family owned joint, and it shows. Their passion for their restaurant is evident. They were packed, and they still treated my wife and I like we were one of only a few customers. They were courteous and complimentary throughout the entire meal. The menu is very plain, but they do it right. All of the ingredients in the salad bar tasted fresh, and awesome. The California Burger is very simple, and they made it taste extraordinary. My wife loved the prime rib, saying it tasted "How beef should". They had an awesome beer menu, as well. Lots of imports and craft brews.  I will be frequenting this restaurant from now on.

__eCyKb6xCPzSlhjTnKxKg.text: Visiting from out of town, my friend found Feeney's from an Internet search.  The three of us were in the mood for steak and this place seemed like it fit the bill.  We were seated immediately, towards the back of the restaurant.  That's person number one we encountered.  The second person came and filled up our water glasses.  After waiting awhile a third person came to take our order.  Not one of the three people we encountered asked if we wanted anything else to drink besides water.  Meanwhile at the table across from us, wine and other cocktails were brought to their table and also bread.  We thought they may be dignitaries because of the great attention they got compared to our pithy service.  When we saw the bread, we asked for an order.  It was brought to our table but the server appeared put off by our request. Our steaks finally arrived served by yet another person. The filet was dry and served on tomatoes.  The ribeye was overcooked.  The prime rib was nothing to write home about.  When we were ready for the check we had to ask someone for it and yet another person brought it out.  Overall, service was poor to say the least.  The meal was meh.  Find somewhere else to go, or perhaps if you are a dignitary, your experience will be different.

Y5FuAJYjuibYpRPYmkNOwA.text: Omg. The hubby and I ate here last night for dinner on our random getaway to Phoenix AZ.  Its a diamond in the rough!  The staff was so amazing. You felt the love when you walk in the door... the food was so tastey!  And never once was our cup empty! We were so full and satisfied Well worth the drive from Riverside CA. The hubby says we'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp cocktail for appetizer :-)

Rg7ZMsaLpnIT_4MdAyzqFQ.text: I came here for dinner one night because there are always cars in the parking lot and I live close enough to walk. The atmosphere was nice. It's old school yet romantic and laid back.  The salad bar is just a salad bar. There is nothing that makes it a great salad bar but I do like salad so I did eat some!   I ordered the prime rib with mashed potatoes. The prime rib was very good. There was tons of fat on my piece but that's pretty normal.  The potatoes were great.  I was shocked because you can tell they are made in house and so many places now used instant stuff.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because it's a little overpriced for the area.

wIASYxeoY1hXc21Og2JtrQ.text: Great neighborhood bar. Took my friends there after they helped me move just around the corner from Feenys. I've enjoyed it ever since. Awesome peeps and great hospitality.

lRgYAUE0a7QWZYduTtLygQ.text: This place encapsulates everything good about grassroots family-owned dinning. Amazing service, awesome food, very cool atmosphere. Total pride and ownership from the family, at point. Prime Rib was thick and plentious, way I like 'em! ;) salad bar was very good. Great experience all around.

z1DO4enswZK2iBV4kg_TGw.text: My girlfriend and I had come in here on Saturday. I was planning to bring her on a Wednesday but she was so moody and angry...it was hard to accomplish anything with her. Wednesday is when they have some pretty good specials at good prices I hear, Thursday, and one other day I believe.   In any which case, the parking wasn't bad...I got a spot up front. However, the parking lot was like a strip design so if you have a large SUV like I do, you might have issues with reversing and leaving, etc.   The place looks pretty old school. There' s a small patio in front for smoking and presumably eating as well with some coasters and a TV inset...was pretty nice.   There's a small bar to the right when you go in and a salad bar and probably the cooking area front to the rear. I presume the bathroom is off to the side as well. When you get in, there's a small waiting area/lobby to the left. It looks pretty comfy on the couch.   We were shown our seats immediately. We waiting a few minutes for our server to get our drinks while guys were cleaning up our table off to the corner meant for two. They were quick about it and the busboy made some small talk, everyone seemed fairly friendly.   After our waitress took our drink order and appetizers which, was a potato skin appetizer we got free since I checked in on Yelp!Mobile and crab stuffed mushrooms, we probably waiting another 15 minutes for her to come back and take our order. My girlfriend picked out a filet mignon med-rare with rice pilaf and a side of steamed vegetables instead of the soup or salad. She didn't want a salad and they were out of soup of the day or the soup. I got a New York strip steak with a rice pilaf and a salad. You can either get your salad before or after entree. I went ahead and got the salad before entree since I'm a fat kid that needs to fill as fast and often as possible. They have a salad bar which has some pretty decent selections. There some macaroni stuff that I wanted to try too but I didn't, sadly. About 10-15 minutes after I got my salad, the steaks and stuff came. My girlfriend thought her steak and food was pretty good. I thought my steak was pretty good even though it looked way more rare than I usually would get. Let's be honest, when she asked me how I wanted my steak, I wanted to tell her, "breathing." Heh, a page taken right out of Chuck Norris' book.  Anyways, the food was good. The check came out what I expected and we left pleased. I would come back again since my girlfriend liked it here.

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. New York Strip rare with pilaf rice side and salad. Steak sauce was delicious; very light on salty taste compare to some places.
Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crab stuffed mushrooms
Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Potato skin appetizers we got free for checking in on Yelp mobile.

CCtxqGAqZL-4_CTcbQFLBA.text: Their lemon chicken soup won over my daughter.  The intimate interior welcomes you as you walk in and the food is superb.  I can't believe I drove past this place for 20 years before finally stopping in.  I'll be dropping in more often.

I-yRVhFq4Fj6FGa3YLlJdg.text: Went with friend, twice now. Once just for a drink at the bar, and next for dinner.   We both enjoyed our meals and the service was good, but overall, i felt like it was a place out of the 70's (not necessarily bad).  However, they were still catering to the demographic that was in their 30s and 40s during the 1970's.  (Hope you could follow all those numbers!!)   What I mean by that is:  the food selection, salad bar, decor, and overall ambiance was made for my dad or grandfather and hasn't updated for four decades.   E.G.: my dad LOVES Liver-n-Onions, and Feeney's is famous for it.   I would recommend Feeney's to people at least 60  (or wiser) who are looking to have that feel of Phoenix fine dining in the 1960s or 70s.  Any younger than that, and, well.... I think it's hit-or-miss.

2L8YCgFvLXb1dqexj1B8Bg.text: 2nd visit to this great restaurant. Arrived during daylight hours 4-5pm this visit and noticed it appeared more of a locals type spot. Bar was packed with folks watching sports. We were first and only diners. My wife has had prime rib on both visits and it was done perfectly to her liking both times. I had Osso Bucco. No knife needed. Fall off the bone pork shank served on mashed potatoes with a wonderful gelatinous mushroom burgundy gray. Wow! Both entrees were around $22.00 ea and include salad bar or soup and side. For $2.00 extra you can get a monster sized beautiful baked stuffed potato. This visit Yelp app offered a free Potato Skin appetizer. It was excellent, not oily or greasy like majority of restaurants serve. My only recommendation would be concerning the salad bar. I would prefer iceberg lettuce and or romaine instead of the spring mix. Had to chew my way through it. Great homemade Greek dressing. Will return when in area.

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Full of salad bar (included w entree) unable to finish 8oz prime cut. Done perfectly.
Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Osso bucco

B5yb2WDviI9Bvc3Z7__zrw.text: Dive bar Local family owned restaurant   Great Greek and steak themes The calamari is fresh and tasty All the plates so far are cooked to perfection  Quick fast service with drink selection  Will continue to come

nK8wZpEsZoos8sUB5ieRyg.text: I have driven by this place 100's of times and never stopped here. Every time I passed by the parking lot was full and I always saw the sign out front with this giant steer on it. As my interest finally got the best of me, Twyla and I decided to give it a shot for dinner.  Upon arrival, we were greeted at the door with a warm welcome and then walked into the restaurant and seated. May I say that the service here was spot on and the staff amazing. Our food was exceptional! The twice baked potatoes are the size of Texas and every course was directed with timeliness and care.  A mother and her son are the owners and operators. They reside from Greece but have been here a long time and operating this fabulous restaurant. From the chilled pewter plates at the salad bar to the "never having to ask for anything, including to go boxes." this place was awesome! I'm calling it a hidden gem because most people would not know to go here.  It resonates the old steakhouse feel with dark wood and rustic decor.  The bar screams to be hung out at and the crowd there was good. I added pictures of the menu as the portions are massive and the prices are half of other local steakhouses. The wine list needs a boost or I would have given this establishment five stars.  So, both Twyla and I would highly recommend a night out. The owners are so fun and hospitable but so are we... Enjoy!  #Vino2 #Vinosquared #Vino2ultimate #Irishcatv2 #jimsboisset

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

8rV03aqidEjklonDI9zA7Q.text: This place has a cozy atmosphere and friendly employees.   I like that it's dark inside while having that neighborhood feel when you want to slip in for a drink.   Food is very good.

J2mkUgiGY4Fs1S1bpYT0vw.text: This place is great!  The ambiance is fantastic.  The service is so friendly.  They make you feel like family.  The well drinks are a bargain.  The prime rib is delicious.  Enjoyed the snails but wouldn't order them again as they weren't served in the shell.  I like the salad bar as well.  Did not care for the baked potato as it was still hard in the middle and the twice baked potato was way too salty even though it looked awesome.  The mud pie was amazing.  I have been craving it.  Needed a steak knife to cut through the yummy, thick Oreo crust.

sLbASKlRG-15fAjv56rB3Q.text: A nice hidden gem in central Phoenix. Food was really good and you feel like you stepped back into the 70s with the decor. I plan on heading back over to check out their brunch.

N1aZrxN1O8q-IboTewRFYA.text: A M A Z I N G!  Great place. Service was friendly food was fantastic!  It was pricey but worth every penny! We will be going back.

Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 16oz prime rib with twice baked potato
Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 16oz prime rib with baked potato

ACpLYKTVNjMjKiGsw43ziQ.text: Over the top atmosphere for a small family place. Had dinner with a couple of friends the other night at Feeney's, great steak place. Once you get past the entry/outdoor area, which is the smoking area, you are into the main restaurant. Inside the decor is warm and inviting, not just one giant room, but a lot of small areas where you can eat, talk and enjoy the company of those you are with. My friends frequent Feeney's so they were known to the owners and the staff. We had salad bars and a steak. The salad bar is plentiful and comparable to other salad bars in many places. That is not a negative as I love salad bars and often that is my dinner, a good salad bar. The steak, which we split was excellent, with the right amount of spice and cooked beautifully.  I do not go to many "meat" places, but if I want a hunk of steak that will fulfill that need, I now know where I will go.

5cs2-C93vkwUu7VrWefMHQ.text: I have eaten here several times and have had many items on the menu except for the steaks.  I hear the steaks are really good by the way.  I like the old school look to this place.  Feels very comfortable.  There is a nice bar area by the front and a few rooms for dining plus a salad bar that is pretty well stocked.  Service is always good.  I have never had to ask for a server to come by.  This place is always busy for dinner, a couple of times I could not even find parking.  My last visit I was able to park close to the door.  I ate at the bar once at that was nice too.  I had the trout but for some reason it was not as good as other places I've had the trout.  I also had the Osso Bucco, $22.95, and is was pretty good but was missing a little something.  I had broccoli as a side and even though it was bright green, it was somewhat tough.  The Chicken Picatta, $18.95 was kind of a disappointment.  The chicken breast is supposed to be pounded but was not which often makes the breast dry.   It makes such a big difference I don't know why some places are not wiling to pound the breast this as it should be for many of these Italian style chicken.  I would not recommend this dish or the Chicken Marsala because it also should be pounded. (check out any receipe online).   I should probably try the steak because this is a steak place after all.  If you live in the area this place is definitely worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork osso bucco

FGwiSowMCdY3H7TRB3GSvw.text: My family of 4 all enjoyed the top sirloin steaks!  The beef soup was great, baked potato and everything was great.  We look forward to coming back again

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

B3feM64xmrwUQsUrq-ErXQ.text: Well, we had very higher hopes with all the reviews.  All I can say is we probably should have ordered the Prime Rib which apparently is world famous.  My girlfriend ordered the filet medium which came out as very rare and I ordered the filet and lobster.  The lobster was so horribly cooked it was like cutting and eating rubber.  My filet was medium so I swapped with my girlfriend.  I could only eat the cooked edges of the steak at that point. Also had mashed potatoes with gravy.  Should have asked for extra gravy because the potatoes were extremely dry.    If you do chance this place I would avoid the lobster and potatoes and make sure they understand how your want your steaks cooked.

rR9WEAG8y6sQ1HbI631yDA.text: Great service and amazing food! The twice baked potato is a meal in itself, but a must have.

j6L7R_0FaMWBONw0mixF2w.text: A fantastic local spot! Maria and her staff all make you feel like "one of the family"!!!  Food was delicious and service excellent! The atmosphere is so welcoming!  Every time we are staying in Phoenix we try to make it this great restaurant! We will be back again and again for sure!

F2ziKCvj7Em1l2uINWNz7A.text: Great old school hidden gem to try in Phoenix. Okay, let me be clear - this is not ruth chris, flemings, or any other upscale steakhouse. This is old school 1960's-1970's steakhouse that looks its age with the vintage salad bar in front of an open kitchen to boot. Yes, it needs up grades, fresh carpet, whatever. Still, the steaks we had were great!  First off, make a reservation - the place was packed on Saturday night. The owners are there to great you once inside and as we waited for our table guided us to the bar for a cocktail. Drinks from the bar were strong and wine was a large pour. After a 10 minute wait we were seated.  The menu is not too big but is mostly meat heavy with some greek dishes peppered in as well. We opted for the ribeye and the prime rib both with twice baked potato (upcharge but worth it!) and salad bar. Salad bar was good, not too big but, at a steakhouse all I care about is how good the meat is so...  Steaks arrive and the ribeye is marbled a little more than I would hope but, very tender and juicy - twice baked potato was crazy big - like a small nerf football! The absolute star of the night was the prime rib - awesome. Cut was perfectly cooked and crust was spiced just right.   Overall, service was good, the owners were friendly, funny and made us feel like we were visiting their house for dinner. Place had all types of people from regulars, families, couples, suits, etc. It was a very causal atmosphere. FYI - parking can be a challenge too. So yes, the ribeye was good but, I will come back for that prime rib! I've read other reviews and the prime rib wasn't that good - on our night they nailed it!   Cool spot to check out at least once if you live in the valley.

LMdLXioRTwdg-3Nso6gw5w.text: I love love this place!!!! Is it the old school ambiance! Is it the amazing people that make this place the place to be!!! The happy hour rocks! Where can you go to a place that everybody knows your name!!! This is our second time here and the regulars remembered us from the first time. Judy the bartender is beyond awesome!!

RuThjzcoRtX7cvAvuvAoMA.text: A great local spot!!  Very European feel with dark wood and low ceilings.  Marie is very warm and friendly!!  The food was good!!  I had beef Wellington one evening and prime rib the second evening.  Highly recommend and i would eat here again! Oh. The sangria was very flavorful, not too sweet!!

eP6Ze2PgLm1mrKOBoo448A.text: Excellent Osso Bucco!  Everything was great.  Love the salad bar.  Prime rib was very good.  A+

W7XEW9cwqa97yvahpOt28w.text: Every two weeks we visit from California.  I'm glad we finally decided to take the chance and visit Feeney's.  The food:  Both my wife and I ordered the Top Sirloin. Beyond my expectations the steak was extra thick and cooked perfectly. Ask your server to add extra cracked peppercorns (you'll thank me later). The side was a loaded baked potato included with the entree, DELICIOUS.  Atmosphere: The setting is low light at wooden tables. If you make a trip to the salad bar you can watch the chef cook your steak right in front of you which is pretty neat. The noise level is about a 5 out of 10 which is pretty good considering Feeney's has a full bar inside as well.   The service: We were greeted at the door and seated immediately. Our waiter George  Was on the money! Never left us waiting and kept my glass full (coldest 805 on tap).  Bottom Line:  If you've been wanting to take the shot...DO IT!

Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Perfectly cooked medium!

JX7i-MiS_ZH8QI0KsOpWzw.text: Went to Fenneys on a Saturday night and the service was great and the food was even better.  We had a reservation and arrived a few minutes early and every thing was ready for us.   Had a appetizer with filo and filled with spinach.  The salad bar was limited but good with the selections they had and the blue cheese dressing was great.  My wife had the grilled salmon with the greek seasoning, she said not much taste but the salmon was very good. I had the queen cut prime rib and was some of the best prime rib I have ever had.

M-AmjxA0aYObm2YSRhhL0w.text: One of a kind place with a personal feel. Good luck visiting even once and not feeling like you are with friends. The food is great as well. Served quickly, and cooked well. One of a kind place.

UyM5TgFFW02swaZ6T82B5w.text: I love the local vibe of this place. It's very old school, nice old bar, low ceilings, dark lighting, etc. The food is very good, especially if you can get the prime rib. Salad bar has lots of selection. Can't go wrong. Parking can be a challenge on busy nights.

CvSC0rn3ySj1jiPHKqOSMw.text: I will start off by saying that I came in craving a beef Wellington & my craving was definitely fulfilled! On top of the wonderful Wellington, the service was top notch. The bus boy was one of the friendliest guys I've met, so talkative & attentive. Our server & owner, George, was great. When you check in on yelp you get free potato skins, which were yummy! But on top of that, George gave us two free glasses of wine, for what he claimed to be "a long wait". We were enjoying our time, certainly didn't think we had been waiting long for our food at all. And finally, because it was our first time there, he brought us a delicious mud pie. Seriously... We needed them to wheel barrel us out of there, we had so much food.   They're a family run business, which I can appreciate as I have a family run business as well. They made us feel so welcome. We will definitely be back.

V1hTdWrjN-Lzau6x1raAtQ.text: This place looks like they haven't changed anything since 1955. It's the kind of steakhouse my grandfather would have loved. They do all the classics really really well. The beef wellington is exceptional.

ZhHIs2F0aMys09odOeSXNg.text: Confession - I am remiss in writing this review.  Feeney's great meal and service was an excellent compliment to a great evening with friends!  You see, this raucous bunch took the place over on a Saturday night and while we were by far the loudest table they didn't mind a bit.  From @AZvern to @audreyrlwyatt to @TheDottsyZ to @ThomasWSmith to @lupnacca to @chrissyP71 to @cutepup8191 we all had a great time and enjoyed the old school food and service very much.

NUrkdUVawOWwgqdHgRKwjA.text: I find it very difficult to write this review. I really like to patronize the little guys and the independent restaurants. So to write a bad review for one of them is very difficult. Feeney's has been in central Phoenix for many many years and I really wanted to like it but our experience was so bad, I cannot in good conscience write a good review. My aunt and I decided to go to Fenney's for our monthly girls night dinner. My husband and I had been there a few months ago and did not have a great experience but I really wanted to give them another chance because of their long standing in the community. My aunt and I had an equally bad experience starting with walking into the restaurant and not being greeted by anyone for more than five minutes. We stood at the hostess stand and waited and waited and waited for someone to approach us. I could understand if they were busy but we were probably two of only five people in the entire restaurant. When we were finally approached it was by a young waiter who seemed very unhappy with his job and seemed put out by having to interact with us.  He asked us if we had reservations which was laughable considering there was no one in the restaurant!  When we said no, he hesitated and looked down at the reservation book and then hesitated some more and finally sat us.  My aunt ordered an iced tea with a lime instead of lemon. The woman who took our drink order who I think was one of the owners said that was fine and then promptly brought my aunt and ice tea with a lemon. Seems like a little thing but starting out the evening it seemed like a bad omen. I ordered a glass of Chardonnay which was not delivered and I had to ask again if I could get my glass of wine. We looked over the menu and I asked about the beef Wellington. The owner said she could not make me the beef Wellington because the oven was broken and the pastry would not turn out properly. My aunt and I were confused as to how a restaurant could be operating without a working oven but we proceeded to order steaks.  My steak was good but gorgonzola sauce was not hot and was sort of congealed because it was not hot enough. The steak I ordered as medium and it was delivered very well done. My aunt's fillet mignon was good but the baked potato was overcooked and shriveled on the outside. The salad bar was so sad. There was a small amount of romaine bag-type lettuce in the  lettuce bowl and many of the toppings were empty. There were no tomatoes, no cucumbers, and there were several other containers for toppings that were empty.  We were there at the beginning of the night so I am not sure why the salad bar was so picked over. The service was also horrible. My water glass was never refilled, I was never asked if I wanted another glass of wine, etc.  It was overall not a great experience and we ended up spending over $100 so you would expect at least a minimal effort on the restaurants part. I've given this restaurant two chances and now we will move on to some of the other restaurants that have opened in the central Phoenix area.

_veeFKU-170euQAlxOafsQ.text: From being greeted at the door by the owners to a great dining experience.. This place is a True hidden neighborhood gem. The food is awesome and rarely disappoints. If so they make it right.. This is definitely on my top 10 favorites in the valley.

j8_djLFxNaOZaxF5k9U39Q.text: My husband wanted prime rib and he wanted to try something new so I went on yelp to find reviews on steakhouses in our area. I came across Feeney's and they had 4 stars with quite a few reviews so I thought that was a good start. I had never heard of them so I was a bit hesitant since I'm a pretty big foodie and eat out 4-5 times a week. We were game and went for dinner. The ambiance is old and kinda dark but not in a creepy way it had a coziness to it. The greet from what I suspect was the owner was warm and inviting. We ordered wine which they had a nice selection and apps...calamari. The calamari was seasoned well but just a bit greasy. Still a decent start. I ordered salmon and asparagus, the Mr ordered prime rib...I enjoyed my salmon. It was cooked perfectly and seasoned... Hubby said his prime rib was very good also. They had a salad bar that comes with your meal but I shun buffets or any good that is not delivered directly from the kitchem so I passed... but my husband tried it and he ate his whole salad. We ate good, had good service and the price point was very good our meals with wine and an appetizer was $88 so in comparison to most steakhouses that's pretty good. We both said we would go again. Its not fine dining bit definitely solid and a great neighborhood spot. The food was good.

PIfGQJYmrh4StRANzT0gGw.text: It was clean and quiet and my mother's walleye was very good, my Shepard's pie was alright but my wife's liver and onions was the worse she's ever had.  Also there was no bread or anything and it took probably 20-40 for our meals to arrive and they did no one came to check on us.  Won't be back.

AZsgUDB-I6xgXMz2ehbu8Q.text: This is an amazing hidden gem in Central Phoenix. Maria and George are amazing hosts. The atmosphere is perfect and the food is outstanding. Outside seating with big screen is great for game day.   A must if you are in Phoenix

xT5GZPDb6HfuE5skf_8hfA.text: My favorite place to go any day of the week! Tonight I had a tasty juicy burger with sweet potato fries. I usually add the salad bar because it's always fresh from the garden fresh.  If you want great food at a family owned business this is the place for you.

uGq88WoH1UCFCkdcN5GQhw.text: First time here. The owner is super sweet. She waited our table.  Salad bar was an excellent perk. Very fresh and kept stocked. The prime rib was delish. Kids loved their burgers. Chicken kabob lacking major flavor but the owner changed it and let us take it home. What a sweetheart. The table next to us shared their enormous slice mud pie slice with the kids. What an awesome neighborhood experience. I would recommend for sure.

876dsacbQZa8kyLM5f9khg.text: Best lamb chops I have tasted since I visited New Zealand. Sweet potato fries were the best I have ever had. I am definitely returning to this restaurant. Beef Wellington was cooked perfectly and the sauce was exactly as it should be.

_3SoX8i2zJgMrbT6GBrLuQ.text: Great great great!!! Awesome beef Wellington and prime rib. They have great specials if you do not want to spend a lot of money. The service is phenomenal and the atmosphere is perfect. I highly recommend this place

_gtqj9bCXJmnYBuoNGfRSA.text: We came here around 5 on a Sat. evening and it was already really busy! Surprising for such an early nite.  The ambiance was really cool, brick walls, old-time feel that we found refreshing among so many new and modern places everywhere else.   The server was very busy but attentive and helpful. We both ordered chicken dishes with the salad bar, which was well-stocked with a lot of options, all of which were fresh.  The prices were fair and the portions were reasonable.  I wouldn't say the food was anything extraordinary but it was tasty, hot, and filling.  We'll be back when we're in that area of town again, for sure! :)

SBiYvtmbJHU7n_s_J_Z3-Q.text: Very small yet quaint restaurant. My fiance ordered the prime rib and lobster and enjoyed every single bite. I ordered the California burger which was delicious. Will visit again

-hkXtn_1rxMX5OgyMB5f9w.text: WOW, first time here and had such a wonderful experience! The food is simply delicious and the service is the friendliest I've had ever! The owners were present and greeted every table as they made sure to keep a tidy environment. I will be back and recommend this place to others.  It's such a nice non-chain local spot to support!

EvrS7SAL-5BkL-8W1Xo-Fw.text: The staff was friendly but the food was terrible. Salad bar looked days old and the prime rib was the worst I have ever had.

n6cFG-BDjCjjS5WqvtjbvA.text: Only thing preventing a 5 star review is that our steaks were slightly overcooked and there's the possibility that the cheese on the salad bar may have been imitation.  My wife and I went here for a quick dinner out after seeing some of the good reviews on yelp and noticing that we could get some free potato skins (Which were by the way excellent).  I had the London broil, and my wife, the fillet mignon. Mine was very rich but hit the spot as it was exactly what I was looking for the time. Than my meat was cooked about the way I wanted it and was very flavorful. My wife's was a little bit overcooked - she asked for it medium and it came out medium well. All meals come with free salad bar and one side. The salad bar was okay, nothing special but had the essentials and it tasted pretty good. The steak fries that my wife had was actually quite delicious (I had vegetables :( ).  The Decour the place is like a classic family eatery/pub. old-school, and I appreciate that. They have daily specials the best of which is five dollars for a burger and fries on Mondays. If I were in the mood for a burger I would've had that; I will definitely go back to try that next time. Our server was named Maria, and from what I can gather she is the owner of the place. She has a thick Greek accent and was incredibly friendly.  All in all it was worth it and we will go back sooner rather than later.

n2T0fOSRMbiUK-u_tUSx4g.text: I'm a regular. A nice Greek family owns the place. They remember me and treat my family and guests like royalty.  I stopped by near closing one night after taking the kids to look at Christmas lights. To my surprise they made a couple of phone calls and next thing you know, Santa Claus was at my table.  5 stars for service. 4 stars because food quality has been inconsistent. Never bad, but one of their chefs is hands down better than the others.

P3AFBrGq0LmAKbcVP_y7XA.text: Good food and EXCELLENT service.  There aren't many places like this left.  They welcome you into the restaurant like it's their home.  Everyone's seems to be family - customers and employees alike.  This place should be in a Best of Phoenix list.

-h2DwthgiuO5lSDi_ohA2g.text: Spent Easter at Feeney's with friends, very consistent, we all had their fabulous salad bar, loaded potato & delicious  Prime Rib. Maria one of the owners is so gracious & attentive George your Mother is a hoot, thank you so much for The hospitality!

7ysUE9EIMErHrZwSWpl33Q.text: Feeney's is an old-school steakhouse with some really good steaks, seafood, and Greek items like spanakopita and saganaki... it's pretty dark inside, with charming murals on the walls, service is amazing and Maria has been doing it right for years.  My son loves the Beef Wellington - not a common menu item any more, but they nail it.  My wife loves the salad bar.  I've had different steaks here - all good.  The "world famous" prime rib dissapoints though, never had a really tender prime rib at Feeney's.  That's the only black eye for Feeneys - the rest of the food is great, service is outstanding, and prices are more than reasonable!

pY84Vce_r22fGnfiwSv9CA.text: Was here a few months ago as it was rated a very good Steakhouse. At the prime rib and it didn't disappoint. The salad bar, though rather small hit some of the best potato salad I ever had in my life.

HMDTfFTJbYpOYzNQd0rleQ.text: Went here when we drove my daughter to college.  The menu items were a little high for our budget but we ordered the salad bar which was filling enough and my daughter had the pork chops which were tasty. My only complaint would be the cook on his cell phone in between orders.

fZrlANF5Ki2wHktC5R0CQQ.text: First time here and I will be back!   Excellent dinner and dining experience.  Was initially met with smiles from host Amanda who quickly seated me.  Nice restaurant upon arrival and very inviting environment.  Their wine list was excellent with carefully selected wines that complement their menu.  Loved the wide range of menu selections and great for every appetite.  I ordered the humus plate for an appetizer which was exceptional. Great presentation.   Really enjoyed the interaction from owner Maria throughout my dining experience.  I ordered the pasta Greek style bolonase with meat sauce which was very authentic and savory in taste.  Also the bartender who helped in my red wine selection which was very good.  The wine is kept at cellar temperature which is appreciated very much.  Overall a 5 star restaurant and dining experience.  I look forward to being back soon.

0C_KX_4rwYd8iwMOEvaurg.text: I really love Feeney's. They have a very modest but fabulous salad bar that comes with most meals. In my opinion, the Osso Bucco is the absolute best. The ambiance is slightly "dark". Would love a slight update to the building but all in all we love going and the food is very good!

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

sCc32lnMYYbPnaianrKz7Q.text: Feeney's is one of the best examples of an old-school steak house, and their lamb chops are the best in the valley. The owner is so congenial, and makes you feel like your an old friend. I love this restaurant, but want to give the uninitiated a heads up. Feeney's recently increased their prices, as all restaurants must do from time to time. The increases reflect a rather overwhelming average of $5-6 per entree, but neither their website or any of the restaurant review sites, including Yelp offers the current menu pricing.

BuiboeLt96taAeWdZDHuVQ.text: Where have you been all of my life? The food is incredible. I have leftovers for tomorrow so I am happy to continue the experience. The owner is very friendly and provides a cozy environment for her customers. We had a delicious dinner of pork osso bucco and ribeye. There is a large menu for all palettes and diets. We are coming back to check out the Sunday brunch.

1ebX1R3U0VHHBWoY3ea_Fw.text: First time going there and will be back!  Very involved owners, the owner/hostess is from Greece and very knowledgeable/friendly and outgoing.  We got the free potato skin appetizer for Checking in off Yelp.  Our party was a party of four.  Three of us ordered the Prime Rib w baked potato.  The baked potato was huge!  All entrees come with a salad bar, and the salad bar although small had very fresh/good quality ingredients and made for a great salad.   The prime rib was Devine!  Very tender and the Au Jus paired well with it.  My only complaint was the prime rib was a little cold.  My husband had the osso bucco with mashed potatoes and he thoroughly enjoyed it.  We did have to send our steamed veggies back as they weren't fully cooked.  Good food with a charming atmosphere.    We will be back!

-kf3jkQjK5BhqmcWwED3iA.text: Prime rib was excellent cooked to perfection amazing salad bar I have nothing but great things to say about this place I wish I could come back every day great wait staff Secret Service nothing to complain about if you have a chance definitely come here and get the prime rib

J1BuTjoaC7HhkFdNDSOlvw.text: I went to Finneys for lunch by myself and enjoyed their Salisbury steak at a cost of $10.95 serve with mashed potatoes and gravy and a mushroom gravy sauce with onions It was delicious. I also utilized a check in on  Yelp and got free potato skins and they were yummy as well always good  for lunch or dinner.

RMEQhBY7p4GyFx7Xlbf3qQ.text: What a gem! Strolled in here to kill an hour of wait time. Judy was so friendly and so were the other folks that chatted me up. I didn't eat anything, just a beer. Nice inside and like I said, everyone here seemed to be local regulars who were all so cool. I like this place and will definitely go back to try their food. Salad bar set up looked interesting! May have to try that

-yrYSKqLWFiQQ7ba2d6Uxw.text: Loved this place. Mom and I went to see a play so I chose this restaurant and I'm so glad I did!! I had to try the prime rib. Cooked a perfect medium rare, hot au jus and creamy horseradish. The fries were hot and perfectly seasoned. Mom got the liver and onions with mashed. She loved it and said the mashed were definitely homemade. Our meals came with a side and a salad bar. Salad bar was typical. Plates were freezing cold and it had all the usual things but we just loved it. Definitely a must try. Even if you're not in the neighborhood,  make a trip.

S0bQHuI92ylMDsVRTxXnQA.text: Love this family owned restaurant!  My favorite is the salad bar which has all my favorite ingredients:  mixed greens  tomatoes onions garbanzo beans beets cucumbers cole slaw potato salad macaroni salad and more plus lots of dressings to choose from. Consistently friendly service!  They also have nice specials great hamburgers ribs steaks chicken and appetizers. Yum!

CKadONJpAG39wN1vLmOmqA.text: Drove our for the prime rib reviews.  It was a big and beautiful piece of meat but it was a little on the tough side. Might be because it was closer to medium than the medium rare we ordered.  The salad bar was basic.  The osso bucco was very tasty for pork, I prefer veal.  However the twice baked potato and service were both solid 5's!

SWa7lZ34QLyEyyWud-vzXw.text: Feeney's is still bringing their A game. Got the pork chops and they were so moist and full of flavor. Very basic and served with a lemon wedge. Who knew simple could be so good.
