SG9s3EAiznLTL58F1O8OeQ.text: What a wonderful place.  They accommodated are large party with so much graciousness, and so many smiles!  And the food?  Awesome!  Steaks, prime rib, lamb chops!  Such a nice meal.

0PIF9s_7WMAc1exzpyu07g.text: The worst steakhouse EVER don't go here. My dad ordered the lobster and it was raw we sent it back and they took it off the bill. Then on the salad bar there was a bug I ordered the steak it was ok but not my favorite I would not recommend this place it's too dark you can't even read the menu.

tt_9t5NZ7jSr-yq5iVyjVA.text: Judy took our reservation and was sweet and accommodating from the start. Then our service was pleasant and made our party of 15 feel like home. Thank you for the hospitality!!!

mOEBLa2fabVOWMOyc3nG6Q.text: We made reservations for the restaurant for our 1st anniversary of our wedding and I asked if this restaurant was high class dining. When we arrived, we did not find high class dining, but we still had a good time.   We tried to order the special flaming cheese appetizer and they did not have it. I ordered the Beef Wellington and my husband ordered the Prime Rib. The Beef Wellington had a great flavor, but the puff pastry was raw underneath. The Prime Rib was definitely delicious and we enjoyed the blue cheese dressing on the salad bar. We tried to end our meal with the creme brulee, but sadly they did not have that either.  Overall the atmosphere was great for a regular date or dinner with friends and we will definitely come back to eat there again.

8_58DD9Zm0GIXB9QQmHkjg.text: We will be back! Maria was a delight, the prime rib was phenomenal and the cheesecake was some of the best we've ever tasted. The Yelp free potato skins were so-so but uhh they were free so whatever. New neighborhood favorite, for sure!!

yTtAodimgG920ux7GlqvNg.text: If you were to ask me how I would describe Feeney's Bar and Grill, I'd say "Good food and atmosphere ruined by overall lackluster service and a rude bartender."   We had been waiting for 20 minutes before I got impatient and had to ask for service. It was another 10 before someone had come to see us. Our waitress was friendly enough but after taking our drink order she decided to walk away for another 10 minutes before coming back to complete our order.  We did not feel like valued customers at this point.  However, what really ruined the overall experience was the rude and snarky bartender. She had come to drop our drinks off but when I tried to inquire about thet waitress she cut me off and said I'm a bartender not a waitress and walked off. She may've been having a bad night, but this act certainly made our experience bad.  Lastly, I'd recommend the Salisbury steak if you do go, but the potato skins were tasteless and boring.

fe4LWz55LpXJIDwx98ZtCw.text: Unfortunately, I didn't have a good experience with Feeney's. I'll start with the bad and end with the good.  First, the patio is tiny. If I were to sit on the patio, I had to share a table with someone else. Secondly, although the the wait staff were friendly, service was slow. I had a beer before the meal and requested that I get another when the meal came. My second beer came after I was finished eating. The waitress made the excuse that the keg needed changed. I get that, but it doesn't take the entire time of a whole meal to change a tap. The locals sitting near me suggested that I get the prime rib. $20 for the 8oz; based on the price, I was expecting a decent cut, but not exceptional. I was severely let down. I am aware that prime rib is fatty, but this one was more than half fat and gristle. $20 for about 4oz of edible prime.  Now for the good. The waitress was friendly and called me by name. I think it takes an impressive amount of effort to memorize your tables by name. Props to her. The potato skins appetizer was very good and had an adequate amount of sour cream on the side (I love sour cream). The baked potato was made well. The other patrons were obviously regulars and a whole conversation was happening all around me. They jumped right in to introducing themselves and included me in the talk. Finally, the horseradish with the prime rib was very tasty, with just the right spice.  I will not be returning to Feeney's for a meal, but I think it may be a decent place to drink.

ucZHVkcrHvH7pj11TGEuTw.text: My friend recommended this place to us and we decided to go and check it out.   It was Monday when we went and they their Monday special was $5 burger. We decided to start there for the first visit.   Our server was super friendly. We told him it was our first time here and he made sure to give us all needed information. We got the same treatment from him as if we ordered the most expensive item on the list. That is what I call great service.   Our food arrived and I must say, we were both really happy. I would of paid full price for that burger as well.   On the end our server came with the biggest piece of an ice-cream cake I have seen. It was on the house for us to share. How nice was that?   If you go, I can't promise you free ice cream cake, but I can promise great service, great food, great ambiance....You need more?   Thank you Feeney, we will see you again soon!

0n0egj1eQc7pZ7o9y8MvDQ.text: My new favorite. Stopped in to watch football in the bar and have some dinner with a friend, now I can't get enough.  Prime rib is excellent, Mondays burger special is a huge burger and fries for $5 and the salad bar is fresh and crispy. So far, the food is 5 star. The staff is so great-they make you feel pampered.

zupfYWCCk1eakHFsIxzcdw.text: Prime rib is always available and it is excellent. What is missing from most of the reviews is the 80+ beers available. A really outstanding list. Fine food, but a family/casual feel. Greek choices on the appetizers is a good move.

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prime Rib Baby!

Bhd273Ql5c0N8VPxEuv8Ag.text: I've eaten here several times when I come to town.  The owners are very friendly and the steaks are fantastic.  Great atmosphere to relax on a business trip.

SREy715iyqbNfFyRSJ-jRg.text: I wrote a less-than-stellar review of Feeney's and I've taken it down. I've taken it down because the owner/operator reached out to me immediately after the review posted. He offered me my money back and a free meal. I will accept neither.   Can't ask for much more than that, right?  (A working food thermometer...he'll know what I mean.)  While my own experience at Feeney's is in the past, one has to be impressed with a restauranteur who cares. He DOES care and my guess now is, if you go there the owner will INSIST you get satisfaction. That's good enough for me.

SWRESA_RtBHbM0XrkERF8A.text: If you haven't tried Feeney's for Sunday brunch...DO! It's a truly delicious selection of Mediterranean cuisine...Cretan Dakos, Tsoureki French Toast...a great iron-skillet vegies frittata with goat cheese and aioli. And the bright and shiny Amanda behind the bar!

OdDzaJ7tsN9kxP_hWDKoJg.text: 6th time here, never disappoints.  One of the best Mexican restaurants in the valley. Service, price and quality of food is 2nd to none.

QF7QsqHY9Yc_Rhc5_oimfg.text: Warning: if you dine once at Feenye's, you'll be addicted, and you'll probably be writing a review for a 12-step rehab program that will get you out of the undeniable allure that this Restaurant/Bar has to offer. Having that said, yeah...it IS worth it!  Let me take you through this cozy satisfying experience by starting off with the appetizers that we tried; first few times we went there we were pretty much obsessed with the SAGANAKI, which is a flaming Greek Kefalograviera cheese served with fresh pita bread. We also tried, TENDERLOIN TOAST which is a to die for slice of meat lover's heaven on herbed cheese on garlic crostini. And, my go to fav' now is--GREEK BRUSCETTA which includes feta cheese, kalamata olives, tomato on fresh pita bread, with a glass of pinot noir, you can't do no wrong!   If that didn't tickle your fancy, the salad bar will. Fully loaded with your favorite greens and then some.   After we've been fully appetizerized, we also had a few of their main dishes that were defiantly worth trying twice! Last time we were there I had the CHICKEN PICATTA with lemon caper sauce and my husband had the PAN SEARED TROUT almondine. On another occasion I had the LAMB CHOPS with Greek seasoning and my husband had the GRILLED SALMON Greek style. Needless to say...DAYMN that was some good eats!  Now here's how you KNOW...you just know, that you're in for a night of class A eating, and it is when you're too full to move, but you'll say "yeah...I will take a look at the desserts menu". We had a slice of the ice cream cake that must not be named! Oh yes, it was that intense...chocolate, Oreo, and ice cream...'nough said.  If you're not sold by now, hit their bar with your friends...according to my husband and his friends, you CAN'T leave, thanks to the owner, George, who makes Feenye's Restaurant and Bar an experience that you'd want to revisit again and again.

8ui_DTFxMzVtr5HEki6siw.text: Feeney's is a tradition in my family...It is my mom's favorite place to grab a bite. Let chomp down and Opa Opa Opa at Feeneys..  ~The Good~ Service. Hooo boy, the service. As soon as you walk in its like your family is welcoming you in. I am not a big "don't touch me bro" kinda guy, but the hostess (and I presume owner) is a sweetheart. She took me by the shoulder, made me feel amazing and took me to my table. I had a bunch of flowers for my mother and she made sure I got a big pitcher of water to dunk them in. I did not ask but she was persistent I needed the pitcher. Now its one thing if the service is great, but its another if they provide smiles but crap food...not here.  I got the Pan Fried trout in Lemon Caper Sauce...out of this world. I rarely get fried foods, but it wasn't drenched in oil. The sauce was a bit salty adding the capers in, and really meshed well with the trout. I will try my damnedest to replicate that recipe now. I love trout, and boy did they hit a home run. The salad bar which is attached with almost all meals here also hit the spot and was delicious. Happy hour was available, with almost all drinks being 3 bucks, including wine and well drinks. I got some Cabernet, which tasted about right, not bad, not amazing, just right for the dinner I had.   As for the ambiance and mood, I love it. Quiet and comfy, the lights are perennially dimmed, creating a cozy atmosphere. The staff who are quick to refill drinks and always helpful keep the ambiance rolling strong. I also like the slight hints towards Greece on both their menu and on the murals inside. Very much an independently owned restaurant vibe, which as you know well I really really dig.  Finally, their menu is eclectic, especially seafood. They have 4 seperate fishes on their main menu at any time: Pike, Trout, Salmon, Orange Roughy. That's pretty damn good for a small mom and pop place. They fly the Pike in directly from the lakes of Minnesota fresh, which is great. Overall, strong food selection as well outside of seafood, with dishes like Beef Wellington and London Broil to note.   ~The Bad~ Its an older location gang. You see all the reviews mentioning the former tenants and such. You can go outside, look at the roof and notice its older right away. Inside the walls are mainly filled with murals and it is dimly lit. Some people may not like this set up...actually I know a ton of people who hate any place relatively quaint and dark like this. Too bad for you. Also the prices are a bit high...$17.99 for my trout dinner? A bit much. They have to make their money somehow, and fish spoils quickly so I get it...but still, for trout? Oh well, thats my only real gripe.  ~The Downlow~ I saved the best for last: Their Happy Hour. This place has a spectacular happy hour guys. Every day is a new food special, so you never will go a day without a real kick ass special. Some days it isn't a price special, but a different food item. For example they had Walleye Dynamite the other day, which my father said was very good. Their Tuesday (I believe) Burger Special is especially of note...very inexpensive.  They get 4 stars for strong service, quaint ambiance, Great Happy Hours/Daily Specials, and a good selection on the menu.  Enjoy a Phoenix tradition and stop by Feeney's!

A5t_Ueh_3tynGfUVamkb6A.text: Wow...this place is A++++!  Judy was absolutely hands down the BEST server/bartender I have ever met my entire existence.  I had the baby back ribs and they were out of this world.  My friend had the burger and was also very pleased.  Their beer selection was way more than I expected - maybe over 75 bottles to choose from.   Seriously, this is a place I will remember my whole life.  Judy, if you're reading this, you're the best!  Thanks for making us out of towners feel right at home.

pX-tx9_r1FhVW177cTDIng.text: We had not been in for a while, so when we spotted a new sign and some new additions to the front, we figured we'd give it another go.  We would have wasted less time and had a better time if we'd just thrown $100 in the trash.  I ordered the Butterflied Filet on top of mashed potatoes with the Gorgonzola sauce, my husband had the prime rib. The prime rib was fatty and gristly. The filet arrived covered in gravy.  I'd forgotten that it had the gorgonzola sauce, so I didn't mention it. But if the sauce was unavailable, it should have been brought to my attention so I could either order it without the sauce, with the gravy, or made another selection altogether.   I cut into the meat and it was either not a filet at all or it was a low-grade fatty meat...not lean and tender like a normal tenderloin.  Worse, were the potatoes and gravy...the potatoes either came from a box or were not fresh and the gravy was either over-salted or it came from a jar. I ate a couple of bites, and couldn't eat anymore.  Let me stress that this would not have been a problem if we were paying $10 at the Golden Corral.  And we recently had a similar meal at a place that was about $20 less and 3 stars more.  I am rarely picky about food, I more often bang places on their service. I probably also should have said something.  But I also didn't feel like there was a way to remedy the situation...a sad and drab place that serves sad and drab food probably couldn't have re-made the meal so it was any better.  Better to cut our losses and leave.    We went to the Cheesecake Factory where we could count on some consistency, even though we'd rather frequent our local businesses.  As for all of the 5-star reviews...that I cannot explain.  Lots of people from out of town talking about how fabulous this little hole in the wall and including all kinds of photos...hmmmmm.  Definitely not a 4-star place.  And definitely not a place where we'll take our hard-earned money again.

tATNGNT6lAABG4_N7PJOiA.text: I am not sure how they stay in business? oh wait their prices and low quality food is the answer to that question. Low quality, I am not sure what has happened to this place.. the last 4 times I ate here the meal has gotten smaller and the quality lacking. I took some friends for dinner and they asked that we not go back there again. The salad bar was dirty, the martini's were low quality. I could over look all that, but the place needs cleaned and bar needs remove the Tavern element. A few of the patrons were so drunk and loud, the manager just walked past as one of them almost feel off the stool. I will give it another try, but none of my friends are willing to go back there to eat... ( my liver and onions were Great!).

-Q_bw8F6HtPcuRr47SPn0g.text: Don't be afraid of the location. Small, older neighborhood place that has a lot to offer. Came here for brunch on a Sunday and it was amazing! Prime rib eggs Benedict is great!

f0FFlpoF0ztk-evtqI9R9A.text: I have been here a hand full of times and was never that impressed, That is until I met that bartender and server Amanda. What a great experience you give to people with your smile and overall attitude. My wife and I spent our 1 year anniversary here and couldn't have had a better experience or treated any better then she treated us. Thanks again Amanda! And Feeney's keep up the good work!! Food Was EXCELLENT!!!

iY0eQn_uvboyVHQsGAbbpQ.text: Judy!! Judy! Judy! Ok let me start with I LOVE their salad bar, simple and perfect. Happy hour is great. Their Prime Rib...the best. Honestly it's all great. Judy is the best! Remembers my likes, dislikes and just the nicest person ever. As much as I love the food here, Judy is the driving force for me each week!

ntBjngodPtaj-f05rxfmmA.text: I live in the area nearby Feeney's and when I drove by tonight it smelled amazing, so I decided to stop in and get my dinner to go. I heard that that this place was the first Beefeaters restaurant in Phoenix, so I had high expectations. The restaurant was a small but quaint establishment it with a nice intimate ambiance. When I sat down bartender was extremely busy, so I was offered little guidance with the menu. The bar was somewhat crowded, and there was clearly only 1 bartender for the whole restaurant.  The prime rib was tasty, although a little fattier than I like and had very little marbling.  The mashed potatoes were good, but nothing out of the ordinary. Unfortunately, when I opened the soup it looked (and tasted) just like beef barley. Since I ordered clam chowder, I thought they obviously made a mistake, so I returned thinking it was an error. I spoke with a well dressed older gentleman, whom I presume was a manager and after I explained the mix up,  he explained that they only serve "Manhattan Style" chowder.  When I indicated that I didn't care for it at all, he simply replied that it came with my dinner, and I was not charged for the soup.  I left without further pressing the issue, however, I was truly disappointed that not even an offer was made to give me something else that I would have enjoyed. The food was OK, but avoid the clam chowder - IMHO it was not good at all. I would also suggest to management,  that if a guest cares enough to return to your establishment, regardless of the cost of the item, you should make it right.

QhKUbeHWhMGKNneg3a8ONw.text: HAHAHA so I work in a restaurant and rarely allow myself a night out. My boyfriend and I had a long day at work and decided to smoke a bowl, get a great bite to eat and a bottle of wine. We decided on Feeneys because several of our friends highly recommended it. I ordered filet and a bottle of wine and absolutely loved every bit of it. Amanda was taking care of us and she was absolutely phenomenal. Then the owner had some sort of meltdown. She came out screaming about smelling pot and that she'd cut off someone's legs if she found out they smoked. Uhm...hi I just spent an hour and a hundred bucks in your restaurant but now I'm leaving and never coming back because you're a psycho. Thanks.

KuHaQmpNP7lxQWyBWHewdw.text: What can I say? Feeny's has quickly become one of our favorite places for dinner.  The hostess, Maria, is a star in every way: wonderful, happy, and its impossible to be a returning guest without a hug! Its just a bonus that she says "asparagus" with a Greek accent I find sexy, and my entire table laughs at me every time she says it! The busboy Nestor is usually our personal drink refiller, and a great guy all around.  The salad bar is exactly the same as every 1970s salad bar at the steakhouse your parents dragged you to, complete with GOOD jello!  Steaks are done really well, and its clear the chef cares about his customers. Maria will not hesitate to fix any that isn't perfect in her opinion, too!  The Beef Wellington is a nice treat, as is the Tornado Oscar and other specialties. Definitely try the Osso Bucco and the Greek lamb chops!  Decor isn't a strong point at all - its casual place and nobody cares how your dressed. The food is great and the staff is too!

2rJ8Xks-UO7YjYoo0TSmFQ.text: I came to Feeney's looking for steak with my family. I ended up ordering the lamb chops which did not disappoint. However, I finished off the remains of a teriyaki steak, and loved every bite. The mashed potatoes were tasty, and the gravy was excellent. The salad bar at Feeney's was a pleasant surprise that both I and my family enjoyed. If you're looking for a Greek restaurant, Feeney's is the place to go.

A5hJ7i3dvs8QuyWv4Cm1og.text: This place is the best.  The food is amazing, and the people are great. They are absolutely certain to make sure your meal and time there is the best that it can be.

YUCSuHndCohJFEG4w94rkw.text: Always enjoy it here. The Monday burger special is always good. If we're having drinks we the margaritas.

oOjaTkwZp837MSiU5j-HEw.text: What a cute little place that I never knew existed. I arrived there on Monday night for UYE that Miss Dottsy put together for us. The best part about it was that they had no idea that we were coming. They accommodated us even though we caught them by surprise and we told them there would be at least a group of 15 of us. No problem!! The owners were so personable and the waitress we had OMG. Her name was Linda but I called her "Bubbles" because that woman has a very, VERY bubbly personalty and she made it a point to remember all our names all night.   Now their were a few pros and cons.....   Pros  It was Monday night so the burgers were only $4.00. Although I didn't have one of my own, the bite that I did take was delicious and everyone said that they were good and juicy!   The owners were super friendly. They even bought us a round of beer and gave us each a shot of Ouzo! (I had to declined but wow!!! You could smell the Ouzo seeping from our group lol)   Happy hour prices are really great!! You can't go wrong here.   Linda made sure everyone had separate checks without us even asking. Double score for that one.   I was with a great group of yelpers. Definite plus.   Cons  Parking is a little difficult because the parking is small. But hey that just means you have to get there early!   Their was a weird smell upon arriving. From what I understood, thier had been a back up earlier that day that had been fixed but the smell lingered for awhile. It almost made me leave because it was a little overwhelming. As the night progressed, it did air out.   The area we were in, was very nice until it got dark. There was only one light in that area and made it very bright, but only on one side of the table   The food that people ordered (aka the burgers) came out in weird spurts and some had to wait a ridiculously long time for their food. It was weird but not a huge deal. But it is still a con.   Now will I go back? Absolutely. It really is a nicely hidden gem of a place.

HVA4zv7a6w4hsCJJvCyDVw.text: If you like that rustic, trip down memory lane type of steakhouse this is the place for you!  The food and staff were great!  Do a check in w/ Yelp you get 10% off!

vQonCn5s4ASyqIKbdQdq4Q.text: I have been a regular customer at this restaurant over the last several years and in the past have been satisfied with the quality of the steak that I  order.   But when I ate at the restaurant last month (April, 2014) and ordered the Teriyaki sirloin, I got one of the worst steaks I have ever eaten.  It appeared to be a different cut of meat in compared to what I am accustomed to eat there.  The Teriyaki sauce I was given was a watery liquid with a hint of teriyaki flavor and nothing like the pungent sauce I have been given in the past.   I have also noticed other changes in the service.  They used to serve warm slices of delicious bread, which have been replaced with rubbery rolls. I won't go back to this restaurant.

wZ9V7S90qlvS8GAH48Zw8w.text: Consistent is a great word to describe this place. The food is consistently great; the service is consistently great; the regulars are consistently there. (they're great too). It has a comfortable smoking/drinking patio and great prices during happy hour. The staff and owner is always (consistently) accommodating and friendly. You feel like you are part of the family here.   Food I'd recommend: Any fish served Greek style, the Prime Rib, the burgers and definitely the fillet medallions with the gorgonzola wine sauce. All the food is good though and you gotta love the salad bar!

ojuCpYAD34_vGhCOIukGZw.text: It's burger Monday! This place has the best salad bar prepared fresh everyday and uses the freshest high quality meats. A True central phoenix landmark that caters to generations of loyal customers. Amazing and friendly staff and owner make it feel like cheers... where everyone knows your name!

4pZFeJDZW2LPKg-5RegogA.text: I was really excited to go to this restaurant because of the amazing reviews. Here's the nitty gritty. The service was excellent. Everyone was extremely friendly, gracious, and warm. I felt like I was at a real mom and pop joint. The place was clean and extremely accommodating considering my two toddler boys were running amuck (yikes!) The bad: There's a smoking patio RIGHT next to the entrance. I can't stand the smell of cigarette smoke and it kind of sucked having to walk my kids through it. The meh: the food. As much as I want to give this place a great review for the food (because their service was so great) but I really can't. The free potato skins were okay (yelp checkin deal), the dinner rolls actually were pretty good, the baked potato was... nothing special, and the ribeye was meh. I was especially disappointed with the ribeye and so was my husband. It wasn't horrible, it wasn't great, it was just okay. Maybe my high expectations were the problem, but maybe not. I'll stick with our favorite steakhouse for now (Bobby Q).

OThHCmfXOQaOl5unAqoi_g.text: Feeney's used to be a wonderful restaurant.  However, I have not enjoyed the last 3 meals I received there.  You should get more than 4 shrimp in the shrimp scampi for the price, there is simply something wrong with the cheese on the pasta, and the I had to throw away the last steak because it was just fat.  Hopefully, things will improve in the future.

PLyrlfzPP8LBnwvqcsBbWA.text: Feeneys, you win. I really tried to like the place. We've been there four times. Cheap burgers on Mondays, who can resist? Welll, I now can. How hard is it to cook a hamburger? Apparently impossible. Four times we have ordered both of our hamburgers with little or no pink, and five times (we sent one back twice!) they have come back bloody. Tonight, they returned it on the same bloody bun.  Feeneys, PLEASE teach your cooks what well done means! Fully cooked doesn't mean cinders, but it does mean NO PINK!   The staff is generally friendly and welcoming. Drinks are only fair. The salad bar is great. I give a lot of leeway because I really love small, local restaurants. But really, if you consistently can't cook a hamburger to customer specifications, I can't keep going.

7x6W_YpRW1Twi854hOVIaQ.text: I cannot believe the recent great reviews of this place! Had been meaning to go there for awhile and finally did last week as a pre-Christmas dinner, yuk! The place was dead on a Saturday night, we passed on the salad bar that looked lifeless and tasteless after our server basically forced us to go check it out. Mistake on her part as we saw some of the kitchen prep space that was filthy. The whole place seemed to be in need of a good cleaning. Now the food...I've never had a twice baked potato with so many lumps... My filet was cooked medium like I asked but no seasoning whatsoever...this place had me thinking of writing in to bar rescue or restaurant impossible for them! Definitely would not recommend or return, a shame we spent $80 here.

3n3QGnP7PRp7viCa6KA4CA.text: Five stars for the prime rib!  The best I have ever eaten.

h5lsd1frlBCF5YAhvwQGcA.text: Hated it!!!  I had a pasta dish and had to pay an extra $4 bucks for 2 tiny shrimp.  My husband had a burger, which I swear would have been on the kids menu anywhere else, because it was so tiny.  Our server had absolutely no personality at all.  Would not recommend this place

q8L6DJWMKMY2d0Km24IVTQ.text: My husband and I went here over the weekend and spent $100 on unseasoned, undercooked, and overpriced food! The menu prices suggest that you are going to get a fantastic, fine dining experience but trust me, it's better to just go to a Red Robin or anywhere else you can get steak and burgers. We ordered the calamari and hot wings appetizers, Beef Wellington, Sirloin steak and a burger and none of it was good! The wellington had no seasoning at all! My husbands steak was supposed to be medium rare but was much more on the rare- raw side. His hamburger was not seasoned, the calamari had wayyy too much breading, the wings were soggy.... Everything was just so underwhelming! When a restaurant charges $35 for one entree it better be good... but the best thing about the entree was the side of fries we got with it. Those were at least seasoned. It sucked getting that 90 some dollar bill, and then having to leave a tip. We should have just stayed home and cooked ourselves some steak, or went to an In-n-out. The food would have tasted much better there! Was a complete waste of 100 bucks.

y02fNBb30TtnR9XDgGnRYQ.text: Feeney's is one of my favorite restaurants.  The back room is always quiet, the service is always excellent and the food is very consistently superb.  Prices are very reasonable, especially their specials.    Monday nights are so good in all departments that I'm almost a regular with my family and friends.  Try it, you'll like it a lot.

hhXpapYYsuOUV0HOrMa6dg.text: Super cute restaurant with great service. Fun, local atmosphere and family-like staff after just a few visits. Feeney's Steak Salad for life!

fUOxrJK4tOkx0TDXHpEjEg.text: Absolutely love this place. Great regulars. Go in on Mondays for the cheap hand ground burgers. The Tenderloin Toast app is awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great bartenders!

N82FzLy2fNoWq3oYGhjChw.text: I like Feeney's. I must because I have been eating there for over 10 years. I like the owner of Feeney's (partially because his name is so much fun to say - Elias Pantazopoulos - but he will answer to Louie). Over the years, there have been very few times that Louie hasn't stopped by our table to make sure everything was ok. And although I would like to think it's because I'm special... it's really not. He genuinely cares about the people that come to his establishment and wants them to feel comfortable expressing their likes or suggestions. This place is small and mostly dark (the perfect place for a quiet dinner with your someone special) without one iota of pretentiousness. The brick walls, archways, and dark wood accents give it a little bit of an East coast feel topped off with the tiled exhibition kitchen complete with a shiney copper hood. The menu is mostly comprised of great steaks and sea food, but there are always a large selection of daily specials that are sure to mix things up. Most meals come with a trip to the salad bar... but beware, portions are pretty large, so make sure not to overload before your meal ever arrives. They have a full service bar up in front and if you are looking for a different game venue, grab a seat in there. The drinks are very reasonably priced, strong, and never run dry. They also have a hearty list of apps that you can supplement your drinks with, for the perfect game day fix. If you haven't over-indulged with your meal, you MUST order the Mud Pie. It is a ginormous slab of goodness! Dark chocolate cookie crust, loaded with coffee ice cream and topped with a super fudgy ganache layer that you will want to rub all over your body. Feeney's is a genuine rarity. It's a great little steakhouse that serves up above average meat but doesn't have a foo-foo bone in its body. Call ahead to make sure they have a table and head over to Feeney's. Oh and as Laura B. mentions, they are on restaurant.com so you can get a great deal on any meal. I have to go now... there is a piece of pie calling my name!

tX9MdbmFYUT9VMAp9jV-pw.text: I LOVE Feeney's!  Stopped in with a friend a few years ago and have been coming back ever since.  It's a family run establishment that makes you feel as if you are a part of their family!  They ALWAYS take care of you here!  So special!  Thank you, Feeney's!

ExYplXxF1AklR9Mv-c1u6A.text: My first time visiting and it was phenomenal! The owner greeted us, as we sat in the lounge by the bar. Brought us a free appetizer because it was our first time. I ordered a glass of wine which was ok, my fault in the choice I made. However,  the owner opened a private bottle for me that's not served by the glass, and proceeded to pour me one glass so I could try it(ended up finding out it's his favorite wine). Two glasses later after he generously topped off my 2'nd(without me asking of course), I've found one of my favorite reds. How absolutely amazing of him. It's really about the little things during your dining experience. This did not disappoint. Thank you to the owner. The food was also very yummy, we split a ribeye that was done to perfection. We will be back again. Highly recommend.

YMTuZFwbAmwTfdUYqy3igA.text: We went here for my husband's birthday on a Friday.  Got here around 5:30.  The place wasn't packed and we had a comfortable corner table.  The restaurant is clean and inviting.  We were immediately greeted as we walked in.  If there is one place I have ever reviewed that takes the cake for best service, it's definitely Feeney's!  For starters we had their amazing potato skins.  I could tell just with the appetizer that we were in for a treat with our meal.  The potato skins were meaty and crispy and crunchy and so on point! They were so generous with their sour cream too!   On to the main course!  Two words.  Beef.  Wellington.  Now I'm sure you've heard of Gordon Ramsay and his famous beef Wellington.  I had the opportunity to try Ramsay's version at his Vegas restaurant.  Feeney's version is very comparable in quality and a much, much more economical version.  The beef was so tender and heavenly.  If I had to make just one comment, it would be that the sherry reduction was a tad saltier than it needed to be. However, don't let this deter you from ordering this dish.  The sauce is more of a garnish than a necessity to the dish.  My husband ordered the prime rib.  I would have loved to eat more of his steak too, but I was beyond full by the time     he even thought to offer me any lol!  If you're looking for a low key date night (or any night) check out Feeney's.  Just be prepared to add them to your list of local favorites.

4iSkbb9CNwhAXm3LwSFBUQ.text: Amazing! Service and food were fantastic! Drinks from the bar were made well, Beef Wellington was to die for. My son had the lamb chops - also very good. My other son had a burger that he couldn't finish (very big portion)! We were too full for dessert but I did see a few go by and they looked awesome. Next time I won't stuff the whole Wellington down and I'll save room for dessert! Salad bar is good, there's a nice variety of appetizers and entrees, and even a variety of sides if you're not in the "full dinner" mode. They have specials during the week, too.   I'll definitely hit them up again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef Wellington!! It was fantastic tasting and cooked exactly like I ordered (medium rare). I&#39;ll be back for more!
Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef Wellington!!

WCJ72fkUS98O_rCZ4sRZuQ.text: Overpriced not even pretentious.  Dinner place comes with a choice of potato but twice bake is $2 more.  WTH ?  Really, at $20 plus on average a dinner entree?    Dinner of steaks were mediocre at best.  I have had better seasoned beef at a bar and grill for much less money.  Price is not the major issue but the place dated, dark and reeks of old.

gEVcApccn__O9bAK9dsG8Q.text: Great little place for a date night, friendly, quiet and fun.  Good food and a small salad bar with fresh items.  We go there about once every two months.

rO-K4xZmaiXcZRYYdlPiEA.text: So my seven month old puppy peed on my comforter tonight because he didn't want to go outside and get wet in the rain... my daughter and I ended up at Feeney's for dessert because it's right next to the laundromat where I had to take my comforter to wash it (it won't fit in the washer at home)... anyhow, what an unexpected lovely surprise of a place it is! Adorable on the inside, nice folks hanging out, and great service. We just got dessert and we were talking with the lady serving us (she may have been the owner?) When I tried to pay she said it was on her this evening. Dessert was amazing and we will definitely be back to have a full meal! We were looking at the the food the tables around us had gotten and everything looked delicious. I'm actually moving right down the street next week and I'm so glad to have found this hidden gem. I manage a restaurant so I know that I expect a certain level of service, cleanliness, and little details at a restaurant. Can't wait to go back and have dinner soon!

YyqJsfUIS4QHgsA7J5BE9w.text: Sirloin was amazing. Salad bar is great. I'm updating my review to 5 stars because the service at our last visit was top notch. Our friends had the rib eye and said it was amazing. The salad bar is always fresh and the ranch dressing is good. If you want a family friendly steak house this is the place to go!

t_IyyvBjRIi1AMf-h3xC2Q.text: Wanted something simple yet fulfilling & I chose to have dinner here tonight.  5 stars for service. Very hands on & friendly. 3.75 stars for overall food. 4.5 stars for value  Trout almondine was HUGE & really delicious. A definite keeper. I would have preferred a little less oil/butter for health reasons.  Prime Rib- great value!   Salad bar- included with meal. Very kitsch, old school feel. Basic; lettuce, onion, cucumber, tomato, olives, macaroni salad, coleslaw, beets   Lettuce a little watery/yet I helped myself to 2 servings.  Free potato skins with check-in on yelp and then he also (I think owner) brought us a chocolate dessert (a little icey) yet we devoured it.   I will definitely return here and get fish again.  Thanks for the awesome hospitality!

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wow! They just brought me a surprise  complimentary dessert!!!

wzmWFpFFJZMT5LoyLRQtjA.text: Stopped by for lunch after hearing amazing comments about this restaurant.  Very disappointed, no one to greet me, stood there a few minutes found a menu after reading it someone finally came to seat me.  The restaurant is extremely dark.  I ordered the prime rib which had no flavor and was cold for a 23.00 dollar lunch.  I will not be returning or recommending this over priced place to anyone.

Cd_sL8fSHcy6lSAmAN-IlQ.text: Man I wish I would have found this place sooner I've drove by here many times and thought it was just some hole-in-the-wall bar so I never stopped in please don't make the mistake that I did stopping here get their delicious prime rib I always thought that Houston has the best prime rib but not anymore I think it's the crust that they have on it and there's not a lot of fat so you can enjoy pretty much the whole thing there  au ju is pretty damn good too taste just like that pan drippings now watch out for their horseradish pretty strong stuff I cut mine with sour cream how much better another definite must is there potato skins crispy and cheesy what else is there had that Ace Pineapple Cider very good it tastes like that hard pineapple candy another thing is their salad bar comes with any meal very good also finished off the meal with a creme brulee it was good I had a lemon taste to it not traditional creme brulee but very good at that Judy the bartender was great made you feel at home and like you belong there like the other regulars that go there definitely will be back very soon

Q63_HGVgPsGaEepjOP-Wow.text: Love the live music. Seems like a good place to just hang out and have drinks with your friends.  Service: pretty good. The staff were very friendly.  Food: I had the Salisbury steak. It was alright. I should've gotten the prime rib!  Tip: Don't forget to check in on Yelp for free potato skins!

DTpWdWPRlmedq9-EoswQpQ.text: Excellent Service!!! Excellent Food!!! Great little hide-a-way that's not your typical cookie cutter restaurant. Great salad bar warm bread and very good prices!  The porkchops are some of the best in the city. Great ambience.  The owner Maria does a fantastic job!

8w1Fxprc0wK9uUDsd2kdEA.text: We showed up after my graduation as a party of 9 at 5:30pm on a Friday night with no reservation. They quickly accommodated us.  Everything we had was excellent. The ribeye was the best I've ever had. The prime rib was delicious. The chicken picatta was good. My son got a kids burger that was great. My daughter got the linguini with marinara and loved it. The twice. Asked potato would have been better with bacon, but were fantastic as served. The salad bar was fresh and the clam chowder decadent.   The menu said they add gratuity to parties of six or more, however they did not add gratuity, so we tipped them even better. This was an exceptional experience. We aren't local but next time we are back in Phoenix will will be back for sure!

KkurmbHkT8idLIMXD1wE6w.text: From the moment we walked in we were greeted and we were treated like family. Outstanding service. The gentleman hosting pulled out my chair for me and pushed it in when we sat down. Our waiter had no problem answering our questions and was very knowledgeable regarding their draft selections. Our meals were phenomenal. As soon as I checked in our waiter noticed and put in for the free potato skins. We were greeted multiple times by different employees and what seemed like the owners themselves. You could tell the restaurant is their pride and joy. Absolutely amazing experience. Wouldn't hesitate to make this restaurant our new go to steakhouse. Worth driving an hour for.

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef wellington. Delicious.

xdQpY0O5cIrQX3g9bHBmVA.text: Visited Feeneys last night for the first time and it will definitely not be the last. We were instantly provided seating although the place was packed on a Friday night. Later in the evening it was standing room only in the bar area and people seemed happy enough to enjoy their drinks standing!  The crowd was mixed ranging from young couples,  families with kids,  and older couples / singles.  The sign says established in 1965 and if you're in a mid-century state of mind, this is THE perfect place. Some of the decor is upscale (there are several dining "areas") some dated, some kitschy, some is just fun, like the disco ball hanging from the room to the right of the bar.  But this is NOT what makes Feeneys amazing. What sets this restaurant apart from most is the exceptional service. The owner himself is working his tail off making sure everyone is not just taken care of, but 100% satisfied! Even going so far as to provide a non menu item (that evening)for us since it was advertised on Yelp. The salad bar has all the basics you could want but I think the key to this salad bar was quality over quantity. There wasn't a wilted piece of lettuce to be found. Beautiful fresh Romaine with plenty of crisp fresh toppings. Cucumbers, tomatos, carrots etc. I had the prime rib and my husband had the Rib Eye. Both were excellent. My husband ordered his steak Medium rare and it was more on the rare side than medium which is perfect for him but something to keep in mind when ordering. Prime Rib is what they are known for and it lived up to the hype. The staff was exceptional. Not only were they friendly but also extremely accommodating.   Dining here is a bit like going back in time. Back to the time when service and great food was the priority!  We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The sign says established 1965 and its perfect because the vibe is mid century.
Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Free potato skins with check in. So good!!

2EpkGA3YAQy-AoX5-tabQA.text: great food, great atmosphere, great service!! if your in Phoenix you must eat here!!!

zz80sPd1cEonoHBbGNvI3A.text: Been here a couple of times.  First time they were incredibly nice and apologized for our food being out so slow (it wasn't) and they offered us free drinks from the bar.  Food was awesome along with the service.  Second time was on Christmas Eve.  Great service, free valet parking, and awesome food.  Steaks are always good to our liking (medium rare and medium well).  Salad bar is pretty good and the appetizers we've tried are good.  The people who have greeted us each time (I can only assume they're the owners) are so grateful and happy you're there.  We've never felt so welcome at a restaurant and they're so nice.  A bit on the "pricey" side for dinner...but it's a steak house.  Given that, it's an amazing price for the quantity of food, quality of food and service.

xmfLZgyes-jljQdxOf9NTw.text: I drive by here everyday and just recently noticed it. I just wish I would have found it sooner! I went for brunch on Mother's day here. I was immediately greeted at the door with a friendly smile. Then places at a table in a very nice room and coffee and drink were brought out quickly.   For brunch they had a prime rib eggs Benedict. Holy S***!!! It was amazing! The meat was so tender and cut like a firm cheese. The sauce was perfect and plentiful. The side of roasted potatoes were seasoned to perfection.

cCBe3bEl4wYa2W1rodIfUw.text: My hubby selected Feeney's for my bday dinner because I have been dying to try a Beef Wellington after watching Hell's Kitchen for years.  Pastry and beef, hello!!!    This place is one of those old school restaurants, tables, and feel.  I remember these places when I was a kid.  We were greeted right away and she turned out to be our server too.  Maria was awesome and her support staff.  Our drinks were never empty and they came to check on us multiple times but not to the point that they are standing over us.    We ordered: Chicken Wings with Ranch - Those little things are spicy but so crispy.  The ranch helped to cut some of the spicy.  Cream of Broccoli Soup - Thick, creamy, and good.  Beef Wellington - OMG, it was good.  It was so good, I could not stop eating.  The mash potato and gravy was a great side to go with my wellington.    Lamp Chops - My hubby loved it!  He said we are coming back!!!  They bread that came with the meal was so good!!!  I ate both pieces of the rye.  My husband had the pumpernickel.  The server found out we were there to celebrate my bday, so she bought me a huge slice of mud pie (ice cream).  It was so good and they sang happy birthday to me.  Too bad, I was only available to have a few bites.  I was so full from the wellington, but happy bday to my hubby, he inhaled MY mud pie.  =)

Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef wellington
Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken wings

ZpgkSD7aItNAmEtXgkDgTA.text: Great little spot ! I would of never ever thought of walking in here. But the reviews made me want to try it out . Great service as soon as you walk in the door, your greeted walked to a table . Prices are reasonable. I only had appetizers but the where  tasty ! If your near by stop by give it a try .

zsPatGQ4WKOv5Odd7cw0Zw.text: We were looking for a good steak dinner while visiting from out of town and we found this little gem.  Food and service were both fantastic.  Great prime rib!  Very casual, comfortable environment.  We will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

v4O8D_ZHuyREOXunCb6g8Q.text: We wanted Prime Rib for our wedding anniversary dinner so I googled "Best Prime Rib in Phoenix" and Feeney's was on the Top 10.  It was amazing!! Appetizer, 2-10 oz. Prime Rib dinners & a good bottle of red wine for under $100 (w/o tip).  WE had a reservation but arrived early...they were BUSY but they got us a table right away.  Salad bar is amazing (great Ranch).  Seems to be a popular local place...the waitresses were hugging their customers...that's always a good sign!!  We'll be back!!!

2bs1TFs2kcbSG_YYJYj2hA.text: One of my all time favorite places. Judy tending bar during the week has locals and long time customers coming in just to see her. She's a doll and a great person to boot. Great little salad bar. Always fresh and well stocked. Burger Monday, Brunch on Sunday and their prime rib. All top notch.

N-aLVrMUBGk9EQvNPMC7HA.text: A friend, a big fan of prime rib, had never been here and wanted to try their specialty. Since I wanted to try their prime rib also, we met up here for dinner last night. My friend arrived ahead of me and told me that he was pleasantly surprised to be greeted as warmly as if he were a long time regular, even though this was his first time in this restaurant. For our entree, we ordered the same thing - prime rib, medium rare, with baked potato. I also got the salad bar while he got soup, and also a creme brulee for dessert. Everything was delicious, especially the prime rib - it was downright spectacular. It was a great way to cap the year off, and my friend says he's so glad he finally tried the place; he now has a new favorite for the new year.

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prime rib, medium rare.

1Ot4T-mnR0cjTJteBLQ5Og.text: Delicious food the service is a little slow or they would get 5 stars...but its not stopping me from going back. Its close to my house and well worth the price.

GbLowHWjApZA9ejDYs01MQ.text: We came here tonight for my birthday dinner, it was our first time coming here. We shared the prime rib and ribs, both were excellent. The service was outstanding, they are all very friendly and attentive. I even got a hug from Judy who is really nice! They surprised me with a complimentary slice of their delicious ice cream cake. We will definitely be back, it's a great place. We've driven by this place for years, I'm so glad we decided to try it. You should too.  FYI- I NEVER leave reviews, so this is really saying something.

Lupfa8fusr3Q54iZF3F4_w.text: I love this place! This is one of the best steaks I have had in Arizona. Perfectly cooked. I will keep going back here

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

69gVHgl-8Otl0A1nQWr_1w.text: tried this restaraunt due to excellent yelp reviews, so glad I did! Had Prime Rib, it was wonderful! Best prime rib I've had in a long time! I highly recommend this restaraunt!

J7a7n5JD1vIuN7ydsLjJHQ.text: We decided to stop into Feeney's as my boyfriend had never been and it has been years (10 or so) since the last time I was there. When we arrived we were promptly greeted and seated.   with menus. I had a glass of wine and by boyfriend had a vodka/tonic. My wine was huge! Great deal. We checked in on Yelp and redeemed our potato skin appetizer which was great! fried perfectly and crunchy!!! I knew that I wanted prime rib as I was craving it and they always have great prime rib. My boyfriend ordered the smaller filet. We both had the salad bar and he also had mashed potato and I had the twice baked for a few dollars more. When my dinner came out I was SHOCKED at how LARGE my twice potato was! I knew I was going to take it home for leftovers as well. This thing had to be 2 lbs don't let the picture fool you...it was dense and huge! I hate my prime rib which was cooked perfectly and the creamy horseradish was PERFECT! Not to mellow and not to hot! My boyfriend enjoyed his filet and taters too and ate every bite. Service was great and we will certainly be back in the future!

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rare prime rib with HUGE twice baked potato! It was excellent!

uQz1xJcfTQIBQQkDH3Z5Kw.text: Very good prime rib, pork chops, and bar. The salad bar is ok. Escargot was pretty good. Been there several times and forget to write a review. $$$ is about the correct amount. Will be back for sure.

-DIXf4tVcwZzVOBC96VF_w.text: I came here for lunch and really enjoyed it. The food was great...even the salad was delicious.I also liked the dim lighting and medieval feel.I plan to come back here for dinner with just my significant other:)

wGxej469v7pEHRke27-Wwg.text: It was our first time I loved it. Judy is so nice and funny. Food is delicious. Atmosphere is nice and quiet for early dinner. We got prime rib and it's one of the best one. Salad bar is a nice addition

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. First time I tried this  beer . It&#39;s different but good

zydoBfqhn-tH7dMdc-dEjA.text: Somebody mentioned the liver and onions here were good.  Didn't take much after that for a small gathering to check it out. They were indeed good.  We also had a couple of shared appetizers. Loved the feel of the place. After the baseball game was over it got sort of quiet which surprised me on a Friday evening. The service was great the whole time. This is a place I wouldn't mind coming back to to try something else on the menu.

4pa3V2ctddOYDh9xf6dPDA.text: I rarely do reviews but I felt like this little gem deserved some recognition! We chose to come in based off the prime rib reviews- it definitely lived up to the hype. It was cooked perfectly and had great flavor. But my favorite part of the meal was meeting the employees. We met three of them- each were personable and took time to ask about and interact with our baby girl. It is obvious that their customers mean a lot to them. They were so warm and welcoming. We will be back!

Ddn4q2H5c21FwGt_pk6GyQ.text: I make a damn good Clam Chowder but Feeney' is the best!!! Absolutely delicious! Hands down the best service and dining experience around!

20xkWA4fg8VgXPfmAphaGw.text: Went for dinner the other night. Had the largest shrimp I have ever seen in the shrimp cocktail!  They make their own sauce which will clear your sinuses.   Delicious burger and fish and chips. We both agreed we need to order the fries crispy next time so they aren't soggy.   Nice salad bar.   Have heard about their brunch being very good so will try that next.   Parking lot is tight so careful parking.  Could have done without having to walk through smokers sitting outside the door.

Z1hzss5nbDJjBX5qCd__FA.text: Had 45 minutes to kill so stopped in for a beer and a bite. Pleasantly surprised they're still here! Wow! Nice appetizers, had killer Calamari! They've a beautiful little lunch menu, great house wine, & bartender Judy is lovely. We'll be back for dinner to try the Prime Rib for Tom, Hummus for me... lobster ... crime brulee - that menu will keep us busy. Nice steakhouse atmosphere, beautiful menu - Can't wait to try the steaks.

gUavU4HlIF3waDlmzggwIA.text: Very friendly staff . Ambiance was nice with warm rustic wood everywhere. We had the Prime rib and the Salad bar. Food was fresh, hot and tasted great.

photos.caption: Photo of Feeney's Restaurant and Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vbbtEvUO4IUXQlsqQ18UFg.text: Don't go if you can't understand the ambiance of a 70's/80's steak house. Do go if you enjoy an old school salad bar, great steaks and lamb and excellent service. This is not The Palm or Del Frisco, not trying to be. Old style and old fashioned friendly service by owner, family and staff. Ribs, and lamb chops, Spanokopita (sp?), twice baked potato and a great salad were our choices. Enjoyed these sitting at the bar and encountered a lovely and very helpful bartender. We plan to return often!!

iqukzob3coC4XQXAlI_28g.text: My husband and I eat at feeneys all the time. We love their fresh salad bar, the warm hugs from Maria and the funny jokes from Judy. Every time we go there we leave satisfied and happy. We would go there even if they served rocks for food the love we get from the owners is amazing all on its own. I recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants to experience True fine dinning.

4jlXTzOYF8KJyxAAA7MgCQ.text: Amazing food and wonderful people! We were visiting from out of state, looking for a great steakhouse, and could NOT have had a better experience! We've eaten at some of the "well known" Phoenix steakhouses in the past, but will forever come back to Feeney's when given the opportunity! The flaming cheese (Saganaki) was wonderful, entrees (filet, strip steak, twice baked potatoes) were fabulous, and the dessert was AMAZING!!! A definite must do for any visit to Phoenix! Quick tip- they must've switched web hosts- to see the menu go to: feeneysaz.foursquare.com.

qtAWOmhiseSN2BgNC_h4CA.text: This is a real fun hidewaway in Phoenix.  You have to put it on your list and stop in now and then.  The staff and peeps there are really friendly and accommodating.  The food is also very good (unbeatable salad bar) and some pretty good steaks.  Had the ribs but did not care much for it.  Fun bar area as well if you go on a monday-thursday when they are not crowded (bar only holds about 10-12 or so).  Anyway, mark it in your books and we'll see you there!!

VgraCNXc0WhfWvXUo0PIqw.text: If you have not been to Feeneys restaurant on 12th street in Phoenix, you have not had the best meal in Phoenix. It may not look outstanding from the outside, however, order the pork osso buco,  prine rib, rack of ribs, or pasta Bolognese or the fried ice cream and you'll love it all.  100s of beers as well. The customer service is above and beyond. I don't know how anyone rated this restaurant lower than a 5 star. Thanks to all the folks there, particularly George. Outstanding!

YDcy-lBidKT0rLbQdMAyJg.text: Awesome family run business !  Super tasty salad bar. A really nice variety of entrees, and daily specials as well.

GcZ3xfALzTOjbFV3c94R8A.text: They really need to update their website! Went in for the HH specials and apparently no more happy hour to speak of! Also, the 10% off coupon  on the website  is no longer offered. I wish I could give their amazing bartender 4 stars while just giving the establishment 1! She is the ONLY redeeming quality they have.

mvJEOY5zotxa_3T-H5FJPA.text: So glad we found this place on yelp!! This place knows how to do potatoes... We tried the potato skins, mashed and a twice baked... all were quite tasty! Happy hour every day from 3pm-7pm. Service was on point!

QuFUgPXs73pQajN2FrgHiQ.text: I found Feeney's on Yelp.  Many good reviews so I thought we should give it a try.  I am so glad we did.  We visited for dinner.  You would probably drive right by it if you did not know it was there.  As far as decor goes, the restaurant is a throwback to the eighties for sure.  It was very clean though.  I had the Oscar Tournedos and my husband had the Prime Rib.  Both were excellent!    Our waitress, Maria, was a very nice woman.  Attentive but not overly so.  She seemed to know everyone that walked in the door.  It was easy to see that once you eat here, you will be back.  The salad bar threw me off a bit, but I liked the fact that they had cold, metal salad plates.  Everything was fresh and their vinaigrette was delicious.  My dish was beautifully presented.  My husband had fries with his Prime Rib.  They were thick cut but they were perfectly crunchy on the outside and light and tender inside.  Prices were very reasonable.  I am excited to go back for lunch next time.  If you have not been here, you must try it.!

cRhI_u7brGXEtWk-eine5g.text: This is a local gem! From the outside it doesn't seem like much. However, the owner, employees, & food is awesome. Try the salad bar & make sure you get some potato salad. It's the best potato salad I've ever had. The prime rib is always a good choice too. I love how cozy & comfortable you feel when you're dining here.

OWZcll8zh6CE-FwrJ8eogQ.text: The staff was super attention, the prime rib was incredible and the cheesecake was the best we ever had. Thanks Freeney's

qJ8ekHqf0OEjC84TizJJ3Q.text: Went here again for the second time in 3 months, and like the first time I was not disappointed. The owner, Maria, is wonderful and so nice, and the rest of the staff is great as well. The food is so good, I have tried the Prime Rib and the Beef Wellington, both are worth eating again and again.

1OUnKRqD-0RuC-e1ATXB8g.text: My husband and I had dinner here a month ago. Always meant to eat here, but 20 years ago, we were too broke, and later we'd pass it, keep on driving and say "next time". Then we were broke again... :-) I bought a Restaurant.com certificate, and we headed over. Two words: Really good. Most of the reviews here sum it up well: Retro, outdated decor. Old-school salad bar which includes Jello. Career wait staff. Funky add-on, remodel areas. Low ceilings. Tight, weird parking. Our food was prepared perfectly to order. I had the filet medallions with the gorgonzola wine sauce- yum! My husband had prime rib, perfect. The salad bar was fresh with LOTS of choices. Service was friendly and competent. The mood in the place was familiar and comfortable- not a stuffy, pretentious feel. I enjoy an eclectic mix of clientele, and that's what they have here. No one looking to impress anyone by being at the local "who's who" location. Just local folks wanting a good dinner, in a comfortable place. Three words: We'll be back.

iub4iTDPKzDd21KPnRuheA.text: Yum! Where do I start...from the Saganaki (flaming cheese) appetizer, Awesome Salad Bar, Amazing Entrees...Everything is Delicious!!! Today I had the Filet Medallions over Gorgonzola cheese mashed potatoes...OMG! So yummy! And of course the staff is amazing! Love Maria, George, Judy and all!! Highly recommend it!

b070tDfRdSwaIS6F0mzg8A.text: Oh yeah. Now we are talking.   This place is so old-school every time I go there I feel like I should be driving an Olds Toronado and wearing a Jantzen Shirt-Jac. I want to travel back in time and show up with Angie Dickinson on my arm and smoke a fat cigar in their bar while calling the waitress "sugar". I walk through the front door and suddenly it's 1972.  And yes, these are good things.  The ceilings are low, there are no windows to speak of, and the the brick arches inside recall something like a German rathskeller.  Along with more modern dishes, the menu features old delights like Osso Bucco, Liver and Onions, and Beef Wellington. At the salad bar  you load up your pewter plate with julienned carrots among other things under a generic "Salad Bar" sign that probably came out of a Sysco catalog 30 years ago. Just behind the salad bar is the grill, steaming away under a large copper canopy. Watch and smell those delectable slabs of meat give up their aroma. An offering to the gods of polyester, Johnny Carson, and the man who reads Playboy.  The martinis are adequate, though not killer. Actually they are probably made the same way they were back when the place opened in 1965. It's only recently that "superpremium" ingredients have raised the standard to lofty heights.  On my most recent visit I had the grilled salmon-shrimp special which came with a couple of asparagus spears, a lemony-butter sauce, a few shrimp and steamed veggies for $21. Hey, as much as I fantasize I need to remember it's not 1972 anymore. Thanks to modern technology I know what my arteries look like. Though the flavors were good, I felt that both the salmon and the shrimp were both a little over-cooked. Overcooked shrimp are safe but rather tasteless. The sauce helped compensate, and the overall effect was satisfying.  I looked longingly at my companion's prime rib, which was delivered exactly as ordered: Medium rare. The prime rib is the star of the show in a joint like this.  There are nightly specials during the week that look like good values.  Though I wouldn't change a thing about the decor, they do need to look after bathroom maintenance a bit, and some background music would be nice.  I plan to return regularly to soak in that 70's flavor. I need to find some white shoes and a matching belt.

BeSfZesXlx2u6OfHzQ1Q8A.text: When you walk into this place it reminds me of the movie Good Fellas. My brother turned me onto this place and it is fantastic. Family owned and operated. Just the nicest group of people. And the food, although not all heart smart from what I could see at our table, was quite delish!

wgShfwcHGhh5ayqiU5w5qg.text: Amazing. We came for our anniversary and had made a reservation through open table (although reservations are not necessary). In the comment section we put that we were coming for an anniversary and as soon as we walked in we were welcomed they said happy anniversary. It really put a personal touch on our experience. The food and service are top notch and always amazing. We had prime rib and steak  medallions which I am already craving again. I can't wait to go back.

Zs-zFnIWBdQOr4FTpxJZUQ.text: Sentimental college days date location!  Revisited this old fav of mine and it was "cheese-burger night!  So a few of us had burgers which were delicious, but I had to stroll down memory lane and have my old favorite the base-ball cut sirloin.      All the food was very good and the salad bar was delicious and had not changed in 29 years!!   The proprietors were very hands on and involved with service the entire evening....very refreshing to see and independent locals place survive this O-Bama economy!  Please give Feeney's a try!

TsJgZOyi_03cAj9qDqFy5w.text: Good solid Ma and Pa Restaurant.   I had no idea this Restaurant was here, and highly recommend you try if if you've never gone.  The Atmosphere is quaint, cozy, and great for a date/conversation.

-UJtRb2GOWmKoAIsptMzAw.text: Such a great place! We have lived just down the street from it for a while but finally decided to give it a try last night. The food was great the atmosphere was even better and the service was wonderful. We had our two children with us and one of the waitresses (who wasn't even our server) made a point to introduce herself and ask the kids' names; they were very welcoming. They have a great menu for both food and drinks and the salad bar was good too. We will definitely be back.

7t7tByLBjT-K2LVPZvdtug.text: Very good local steakhouse. The wine was good and VERY reasonably priced. I had Prime Rib which was delicious and my husband had sirloin and shrimp. Sides were okay but save room for dessert....the cheesecake is made in house and is worth every calorie! We will be coming back...like the old school atmosphere and welcoming employees!
